Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:9: Had we appointed him (Our messenger) an angel, We assuredly had made him (as) a man (that he might speak to men); and (thus) obscured for them (the truth) they (now) obscure.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:10: Messengers (of Allah) have been derided before thee, but that whereat they scoffed surrounded such of them as did deride.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:11: Say (unto the disbelievers): Travel in the land, and see the nature of the consequence for the rejecters!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:12: Say: Unto whom belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and the earth ? Say: Unto Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:13: Unto Him belongeth whatsoever resteth in the night and the day.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:14: Say: Shall I choose for a protecting friend other than Allah, the Originator of the heavens and the earth, Who feedeth and is never fed ? Say: I am ordered to be the first to surrender (unto Him).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:15: Say: I fear, if I rebel against my Lord, the retribution of an Awful Day.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:16: He from whom (such retribution) is averted on that day, (Allah) hath in truth had mercy on him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:17: If Allah touch thee with affliction, there is none that can relieve therefrom save Him, and if He touch thee with good fortune (there is none that can impair it); for He is Able to do all things.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:18: He is the Omnipotent over His slaves, and He is the Wise, the Knower.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:19: Say (O Muhammad): What thing is of most weight in testimony ? Say: Allah is Witness between me and you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:20: Those unto whom We gave the Scripture recognise (this revelation) as they recognise their sons.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:21: Who doth greater wrong than he who inventeth a lie against Allah or denieth His revelations ? Lo! the wrongdoers will not be successful.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:22: And on the day We gather them together We shall say unto those who ascribed partners (unto Allah): Where are (now) those partners of your make-believe ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:23: Then will they have no contention save that they will say: By Allah, our Lord, we never were idolaters.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:24: See how they lie against themselves, and (how) the thing which they devised hath failed them!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:25: Of them are some who listen unto thee, but We have placed upon their hearts veils, lest they should understand, and in their ears a deafness.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:26: And they forbid (men) from it and avoid it, and they ruin none save themselves, though they perceive not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:27: If thou couldst see when they are set before the Fire and say: Oh, would that we might return! Then would we not deny the revelations of our Lord but we would be of the believers!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:28: Nay, but that hath become clear unto them which before they used to hide.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:29: And they say: There is naught save our life of the world, and we shall not be raised (again).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:30: If thou couldst see when they are set before their Lord! He will say: Is not this real ? They will say: Yea, verily, by our Lord! He will say: Taste now the retribution for that ye used to disbelieve.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:31: They indeed are losers who deny their meeting with Allah until, when the Hour cometh on them suddenly, they cry: Alas for us, that we neglected it! They bear upon their backs their burdens.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:32: Naught is the life of the world save a pastime and a spot.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:33: We know well how their talk grieveth thee, though in truth they deny not thee (Muhammad) but evil-doers flout the revelations of Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:34: Messengers indeed have been denied before thee, and they were patient under the denial and the persecution till Our succour reached them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:35: And if their aversion is grievous unto thee, then, if thou canst, seek a way down into the earth or a ladder unto the sky that thou mayst bring unto them a portent (to convince them all)! - If Allah willed, He could have brought them all together to the guidance - So be not thou among the foolish ones.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:36: Only those can accept who hear.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:37: They say: Why hath no portent been sent down upon him from his Lord ? Say: Lo! Allah is Able to send down a portent.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:38: There is not an animal in the earth, nor a flying creature flying on two wings, but they are peoples like unto you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:39: Those who deny Our revelations are deaf and dumb in darkness.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:40: Say: Can ye see yourselves, if the punishment of Allah come upon you or the Hour come upon you, (calling upon other than Allah) ? Do ye then call (for help) to any other than Allah ? (Answer that) if ye are truthful.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:41: Nay, but unto Him ye call, and He removeth that because of which ye call unto Him, if He will, and ye forget whatever partners ye ascribed unto Him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:42: We have sent already unto peoples that were before thee, and We visited them with tribulation and adversity, in order that they might grow humble.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:43: If only, when Our disaster came on them, they had been humble! But their hearts were hardened and the devil made all that they used to do seem fair unto them!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:44: Then, when they forgot that whereof they had been reminded, We opened unto them the gates of all things till, even as they were rejoicing in that which they were given, We seized them unawares, and lo! they were dumbfounded.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:45: So of the people who did wrong the last remnant was cut off.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:46: Say: Have ye imagined, if Allah should take away your hearing and your sight and seal your hearts, Who is the God Who could restore it to you save Allah ? See how We display the revelations unto them! Yet still they turn away.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:47: Say: Can ye see yourselves, if the punishment of Allah come upon you unawares or openly ? Would any perish save wrongdoing folk ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:48: We send not the messengers save as bearers of good news and warners.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:49: But as for those who deny Our revelations, torment will afflict them for that they used to disobey.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:50: Say (O Muhammad, to the disbelievers): I say not unto you (that) I possess the treasures of Allah, nor that I have knowledge of the Unseen; and I say not unto you: Lo! I am an angel.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:51: Warn hereby those who fear (because they know) that they will be gathered unto their Lord, for whom there is no protecting ally nor intercessor beside Him, that they may ward off (evil).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:52: Repel not those who call upon their Lord at morn and evening, seeking His Countenance.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:53: And even so do We try some of them by others, that they say: Are these they whom Allah favoureth among us ? Is not Allah best Aware of the thanksgivers ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:54: And when those who believe in Our revelations come unto thee, say: Peace be unto you! Your Lord hath prescribed for Himself mercy, that whoso of you doeth evil through ignorance and repenteth afterward thereof and doeth right, (for him) lo! He is Forgiving, Merciful.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:55: Thus do We expound the revelations that the way of the unrighteous may be manifest.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:56: Say: I am forbidden to worship those on whom ye call instead of Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:57: Say: I am (relying) on clear proof from my Lord, while ye deny Him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:58: Say: If I had that for which ye are impatient, then would the case (ere this) have been decided between me and you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:59: And with Him are the keys of the Invisible.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:60: He it is Who gathereth you at night and knoweth that which ye commit by day.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:61: He is the Omnipotent over His slaves.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:62: Then are they restored unto Allah, their Lord, the Just.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:63: Say: Who delivereth you from the darkness of the land and the sea ? Ye call upon Him humbly and in secret, (saying): If we are delivered from this (fear) we truly will be of the thankful.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:64: Say: Allah delivereth you from this and from all affliction.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:65: Say: He is able to send punishment upon you from above you or from beneath your feet, or to bewilder you with dissension and make you taste the tyranny one of another.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:66: Thy people (O Muhammad) have denied it, though it is the Truth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:67: For every announcement there is a term, and ye will come to know.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:68: And when thou seest those who meddle with Our revelations, withdraw from them until they meddle with another topic.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:69: Those who ward off (evil) are not accountable for them in aught, but the Reminder (must be given them) that haply they (too) may ward off (evil).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:70: And forsake those who take their religion for a pastime and a jest, and whom the life of the world beguileth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:71: Say: Shall we cry, instead of unto Allah, unto that which neither profiteth us nor hurteth us, and shall we turn back after Allah hath guided us, like one bewildered whom the devils have infatuated in the earth, who hath companions who invite him to the guidance (saying): Come unto us ? Say: Lo! the guidance of Allah is Guidance, and we are ordered to surrender to the Lord of the Worlds,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:72: And to establish worship and be dutiful to Him, and He it is unto Whom ye will be gathered.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:73: He it is Who created the heavens and the earth in truth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:74: (Remember) when Abraham said unto his father Azar: Takest thou idols for gods ? Lo! I see thee and thy folk in error manifest.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:75: Thus did We show Abraham the kingdom of the heavens and the earth that he might be of those possessing certainty:
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:76: When the night grew dark upon him he beheld a star.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:77: And when he saw the moon uprising, he exclaimed: This is my Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:78: And when he saw the sun uprising, he cried: This is my Lord! This is greater! And when it set he exclaimed: O my people! Lo! I am free from all that ye associate (with Him).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:79: Lo! I have turned my face toward Him Who created the heavens and the earth, as one by nature upright, and I am not of the idolaters.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:81: How should I fear that which ye set up beside Him, when ye fear not to set up beside Allah that for which He hath revealed unto you no warrant ? Which of the two factions hath more right to safety ? (Answer me that) if ye have knowledge.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:82: Those who believe and obscure not their belief by wrongdoing, theirs is safety; and they are rightly guided.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:84: And We bestowed upon him Isaac and Jacob; each of them We guided; and Noah did We guide aforetime; and of his seed (We guided) David and Solomon and Job and Joseph and Moses and Aaron.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:85: And Zachariah and John and Jesus and Elias.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:86: And Ishmael and Elisha and Jonah and Lot.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:87: With some of their forefathers and their offspring and their brethren; and We chose them and guided them unto a straight path.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:88: Such is the guidance of Allah wherewith He guideth whom He will of His bondmen.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:89: Those are they unto whom We gave the Scripture and command and prophethood.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:90: Those are they whom Allah guideth, so follow their guidance.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:91: And they measure not the power of Allah its true measure when they say: Allah hath naught revealed unto a human being.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:92: And this is a blessed Scripture which We have revealed, confirming that which (was revealed) before it, that thou mayst warn the Mother of Villages and those around her.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:93: Who is guilty of more wrong than he who forgeth a lie against Allah, or saith: I am inspired, when he is not inspired in aught; and who saith: I will reveal the like of that which Allah hath revealed ? If thou couldst see, when the wrong-doers reach the pangs of death and the angels stretch their hands out (saying): Deliver up your souls.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:94: Now have ye come unto Us solitary as We did create you at the first, and ye have left behind you all that We bestowed upon you, and We behold not with you those your intercessors, of whom ye claimed that they possessed a share in you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:95: Lo! Allah (it is) Who splitteth the grain of corn and the date-stone (for sprouting).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:96: He is the Cleaver of the Daybreak, and He hath appointed the night for stillness, and the sun and the moon for reckoning.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:97: And He it is Who hath set for you the stars that ye may guide your course by them amid the darkness of the land and the sea.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:98: And He it is Who hath produced you from a single being, and (hath given you) a habitation and a repository.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:99: He it is Who sendeth down water from the sky, and therewith We bring forth buds of every kind; We bring forth the green blade from which We bring forth the thick-clustered grain; and from the date-palm, from the pollen thereof, spring pendant bunches; and (We bring forth) gardens of grapes, and the olive and the pomegranate, alike and unlike.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:100: Yet they ascribe as partners unto Him the jinn, although He did create them, and impute falsely, without knowledge, sons and daughters unto Him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:101: The Originator of the heavens and the earth! How can He have a child, when there is for Him no consort, when He created all things and is Aware of all things ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:103: Vision comprehendeth Him not, but He comprehendeth (all) vision.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:104: Proofs have come unto you from your Lord, so whoso seeth, it is for his own good, and whoso is blind is blind to his own hurt.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:105: Thus do We display Our revelations that they may say (unto thee, Muhammad): "Thou hast studied," and that We may make (it) clear for people who have knowledge.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:106: Follow that which is inspired in thee from thy Lord; there is no God save Him; and turn away from the idolaters.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:107: Had Allah willed, they had not been idolatrous.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:108: Revile not those unto whom they pray beside Allah lest they wrongfully revile Allah through ignorance.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:109: And they swear a solemn oath by Allah that if there come unto them a portent they will believe therein.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:110: We confound their hearts and their eyes.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:111: And though We should send down the angels unto them, and the dead should speak unto them, and We should gather against them all things in array, they would not believe unless Allah so willed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:112: Thus have We appointed unto every prophet an adversary - devils of humankind and jinn who inspire in one another plausible discourse through guile.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:113: That the hearts of those who believe not in the Hereafter may incline thereto, and that they may take pleasure therein, and that they may earn what they are earning.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:114: Shall I seek other than Allah for judge, when He it is Who hath revealed unto you (this) Scripture, fully explained ? Those unto whom We gave the Scripture (aforetime) know that it is revealed from thy Lord in truth.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:115: Perfected is the Word of thy Lord in truth and justice.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:116: If thou obeyedst most of those on earth they would mislead thee far from Allah’s way.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:117: Lo! thy Lord, He knoweth best who erreth from His way; and He knoweth best (who are) the rightly guided.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:118: Eat of that over which the name of Allah hath been mentioned, if ye are believers in His revelations.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:119: How should ye not eat of that over which the name of Allah hath been mentioned, when He hath explained unto you that which is forbidden unto you unless ye are compelled thereto.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:120: Forsake the outwardness of sin and the inwardness thereof.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:121: And eat not of that whereon Allah’s name hath not been mentioned, for lo! it is abomination.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:122: Is he who was dead and We have raised him unto life, and set for him a light wherein he walketh among men, as him whose similitude is in utter darkness whence he cannot emerge ? Thus is their conduct made fairseeming for the disbelievers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:123: And thus have We made in every city great ones of its wicked ones, that they should plot therein.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:124: And when a token cometh unto them, they say: We will not believe till we are given that which Allah’s messengers are given.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:125: And whomsoever it is Allah’s will to guide, He expandeth his bosom unto the Surrender, and whomsoever it is His Will to send astray, He maketh his bosom close and narrow as if he were engaged in sheer ascent.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:126: This is the path of thy Lord, a straight path.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:127: For them is the abode of peace with their Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:128: In the day when He will gather them together (He will say): O ye assembly of the jinn! Many of humankind did ye seduce.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:129: Thus We let some of the wrong-doers have power over others because of what they are wont to earn.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:130: O ye assembly of the jinn and humankind! Came there not unto you messengers of your own who recounted unto you My tokens and warned you of the meeting of this your Day ? They will say: We testify against ourselves.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:131: This is because thy Lord destroyeth not the townships arbitrarily while their people are unconscious (of the wrong they do).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:132: For all there will be ranks from what they did.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:133: Thy Lord is the Absolute, the Lord of Mercy.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:134: Lo! that which ye are promised will surely come to pass, and ye cannot escape.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:135: Say (O Muhammad): O my people! Work according to your power.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:136: They assign unto Allah, of the crops and cattle which He created, a portion, and they say: "This is Allah’s" - in their make-believe - "and this is for (His) partners in regard to us.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:137: Thus have their (so-called) partners (of Allah) made the killing of their children to seem fair unto many of the idolaters, that they may ruin them and make their faith obscure for them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:138: And they say: Such cattle and crops are forbidden.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:139: And they say: That which is in the bellies of such cattle is reserved for our males and is forbidden to our wives; but if it be born dead, then they (all) may be partakers thereof.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:140: They are losers who besottedly have slain their children without knowledge, and have forbidden that which Allah bestowed upon them, inventing a lie against Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:141: He it is Who produceth gardens trellised and untrellised, and the date-palm, and crops of divers flavour, and the olive and the pomegranate, like and unlike.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:142: And of the cattle (He produceth) some for burdens, some for food.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:143: Eight pairs: Of the sheep twain, and of the goats twain.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:144: And of the camels twain and of the oxen twain.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:145: Say: I find not in that which is revealed unto me aught prohibited to an eater that he eat thereof, except it be carrion, or blood poured forth, or swineflesh - for that verily is foul - or the abomination which was immolated to the name of other than Allah.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:146: Unto those who are Jews We forbade every animal with claws.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:147: So if they give the lie to thee (Muhammad), say: Your Lord is a Lord of All-Embracing Mercy, and His wrath will never be withdrawn from guilty folk.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:148: They who are idolaters will say: Had Allah willed, we had not ascribed (unto Him) partners neither had our fathers, nor had we forbidden aught.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:149: Say - For Allah’s is the final argument - Had He willed He could indeed have guided all of you.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:150: Say: Come, bring your witnesses who can bear witness that Allah forbade (all) this.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:151: Say: Come, I will recite unto you that which your Lord hath made a sacred duty for you: That ye ascribe no thing as partner unto Him and that ye do good to parents, and that ye slay not your children because of penury - We provide for you and for them - and that ye draw not nigh to lewd things whether open or concealed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:152: And approach not the wealth of the orphan save with that which is better, till he reach maturity.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:153: And (He commandeth you, saying): This is My straight path, so follow it.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:154: Again, We gave the Scripture unto Moses, complete for him who would do good, an explanation of all things, a guidance and a mercy, that they might believe in the meeting with their Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:155: And this is a blessed Scripture which We have revealed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:156: Lest ye should say: The Scripture was revealed only to two sects before us, and we in sooth were unaware of what they read;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:157: Or lest ye should say: If the Scripture had been revealed unto us, we surely had been better guided than are they.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:158: Wait they, indeed, for nothing less than that the angels should come unto them, or thy Lord should come, or there should come one of the portents from thy Lord ? In the day when one of the portents from thy Lord cometh, its belief availeth naught a soul which theretofore believed not, nor in its belief earned good (by works).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:159: Lo! As for those who sunder their religion and become schismatics, no concern at all hast thou with them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:160: Whoso bringeth a good deed will receive tenfold the like thereof, while whoso bringeth an ill-deed will be awarded but the like thereof; and they will not be wronged.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:161: Say: Lo! As for me, my Lord hath guided me unto a straight path, a right religion, the community of Abraham, the upright, who was no idolater.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:162: Say: Lo! my worship and my sacrifice and my living and my dying are for Allah, Lord of the Worlds.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:164: Say: Shall I seek another than Allah for Lord, when He is Lord of all things ? Each soul earneth only on its own account, nor doth any laden bear another’s load.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 6:165: He it is Who hath placed you as viceroys of the earth and hath exalted some of you in rank above others, that He may try you by (the test of) that which He hath given you.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:1: Praise be God, Who created the heavens and the earth, and made the darkness and the light.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:2: He it is created you from clay, and then decreed a stated term (for you).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:3: And He is God in the heavens and on earth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:4: But never did a single one of the signs of their Lord reach them, but they turned away therefrom.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:5: And now they reject the truth when it reaches them: but soon shall they learn the reality of what they used to mock at.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:6: See they not how many of those before them We did destroy?- generations We had established on the earth, in strength such as We have not given to you - for whom We poured out rain from the skies in abundance, and gave (fertile) streams flowing beneath their (feet): yet for their sins We destroyed them, and raised in their wake fresh generations (to succeed them).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:7: If We had sent unto thee a written (message) on parchment, so that they could touch it with their hands, the Unbelievers would have been sure to say: "This is nothing but obvious magic!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:8: They say: "Why is not an angel sent down to him?" If we did send down an angel, the matter would be settled at once, and no respite would be granted them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:9: If We had made it an angel, We should have sent him as a man, and We should certainly have caused them confusion in a matter which they have already covered with confusion.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:10: Mocked were (many) apostles before thee; but their scoffers were hemmed in by the thing that they mocked.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:11: Say: "Travel through the earth and see what was the end of those who rejected Truth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:12: Say: "To whom belongeth all that is in the heavens and on earth?" Say: "To God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:13: To him belongeth all that dwelleth (or lurketh) in the night and the day.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:14: Say: "Shall I take for my protector any other than God, the Maker of the heavens and the earth? And He it is that feedeth but is not fed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:15: Say: "I would, if I disobeyed my Lord, indeed have fear of the penalty of a Mighty Day.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:16: "On that day, if the penalty is averted from any, it is due to God’s mercy; And that would be (Salvation), the obvious fulfilment of all desire.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:17: "If God touch thee with affliction, none can remove it but He; if He touch thee with happiness, He hath power over all things.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:18: "He is the irresistible, (watching) from above over His worshippers; and He is the Wise, acquainted with all things.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:19: Say: "What thing is most weighty in evidence?" Say: "God is witness between me and you; This Qur’an hath been revealed to me by inspiration, that I may warn you and all whom it reaches.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:20: Those to whom We have given the Book know this as they know their own sons.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:21: Who doth more wrong than he who inventeth a lie against God or rejecteth His sings? But verily the wrong-doers never shall prosper.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:22: One day shall We gather them all together: We shall say to those who ascribed partners (to Us): "Where are the partners whom ye (invented and) talked about?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:23: There will then be (left) no subterfuge for them but to say: "By God our Lord, we were not those who joined gods with God
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:24: Behold! how they lie against their own souls! But the (lie) which they invented will leave them in the lurch.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:25: Of them there are some who (pretend to) listen to thee; but We have thrown veils on their hearts, So they understand it not, and deafness in their ears; if they saw every one of the signs, not they will believe in them; in so much that when they come to thee, they (but) dispute with thee; the Unbelievers say: "These are nothing but tales of the ancients.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:26: Others they keep away from it, and themselves they keep away; but they only destroy their own souls, and they perceive it not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:27: If thou couldst but see when they are confronted with the Fire! They will say: "Would that we were but sent back! Then would we not reject the signs of our Lord, but would be amongst those who believe!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:28: Yea, in their own (eyes) will become manifest what before they concealed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:29: And they (sometimes) say: "There is nothing except our life on this earth, and never shall we be raised up again.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:30: If thou couldst but see when they are confronted with their Lord! He will say: "Is not this the truth?" They will say: "Yea, by our Lord!" He will say: "Taste ye then the penalty, because ye rejected Faith.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:31: Lost indeed are they who treat it as a falsehood that they must meet God,- until on a sudden the hour is on them, and they say: "Ah! woe unto us that we took no thought of it"; for they bear their burdens on their backs, and evil indeed are the burdens that they bear?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:32: What is the life of this world but play and amusement? But best is the home in the hereafter, for those who are righteous.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:33: We know indeed the grief which their words do cause thee: It is not thee they reject: it is the signs of God, which the wicked contemn.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:34: Rejected were the apostles before thee: with patience and constancy they bore their rejection and their wrongs, until Our aid did reach them: there is none that can alter the words (and decrees) of God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:35: If their spurning is hard on thy mind, yet if thou wert able to seek a tunnel in the ground or a ladder to the skies and bring them a sign,- (what good?).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:36: Those who listen (in truth), be sure, will accept: as to the dead, God will raise them up; then will they be turned unto Him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:37: They say: "Why is not a sign sent down to him from his Lord?" Say: "God hath certainly power to send down a sign: but most of them understand not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:38: There is not an animal (that lives) on the earth, nor a being that flies on its wings, but (forms part of) communities like you.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:39: Those who reject our sings are deaf and dumb,- in the midst of darkness profound: whom God willeth, He leaveth to wander: whom He willeth, He placeth on the way that is straight.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:40: Say: "Think ye to yourselves, if there come upon you the wrath of God, or the Hour (that ye dread), would ye then call upon other than God?- (reply) if ye are truthful!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:41: "Nay,- On Him would ye call, and if it be His will, He would remove (the distress) which occasioned your call upon Him, and ye would forget (the false gods) which ye join with Him!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:42: Before thee We sent (apostles) to many nations, and We afflicted the nations with suffering and adversity, that they might learn humility.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:43: When the suffering reached them from us, why then did they not learn humility? On the contrary their hearts became hardened, and Satan made their (sinful) acts seem alluring to them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:44: But when they forgot the warning they had received, We opened to them the gates of all (good) things, until, in the midst of their enjoyment of Our gifts, on a sudden, We called them to account, when lo! they were plunged in despair!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:45: Of the wrong-doers the last remnant was cut off.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:46: Say: "Think ye, if God took away your hearing and your sight, and sealed up your hearts, who - a god other than God - could restore them to you?" See how We explain the signs by various (symbols); yet they turn aside.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:47: Say: "Think ye, if the punishment of God comes to you, whether suddenly or openly, will any be destroyed except those who do wrong?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:48: We send the apostles only to give good news and to warn: so those who believe and mend (their lives),- upon them shall be no fear, nor shall they grieve.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:49: But those who reject our signs,- them shall punishment touch, for that they ceased not from transgressing.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:50: Say: "I tell you not that with me are the treasures of God, nor do I know what is hidden, nor do I tell you I am an angel.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:51: Give this warning to those in whose (hearts) is the fear that they will be brought (to judgment) before their Lord: except for Him they will have no protector nor intercessor: that they may guard (against evil).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:52: Send not away those who call on their Lord morning and evening, seeking His face.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:53: Thus did We try some of them by comparison with others, that they should say: "Is it these then that God hath favoured from amongst us?" Doth not God know best those who are grateful?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:54: When those come to thee who believe in Our signs, Say: "Peace be on you: Your Lord hath inscribed for Himself (the rule of) mercy: verily, if any of you did evil in ignorance, and thereafter repented, and amend (his conduct), lo! He is Oft-forgiving, Most Merciful.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:55: Thus do We explain the signs in detail: that the way of the sinners may be shown up.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:56: Say: "I am forbidden to worship those - others than God - whom ye call upon.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:57: Say: "For me, I (work) on a clear sign from my Lord, but ye reject Him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:58: Say: "If what ye would see hastened were in my power, the matter would be settled at once between you and me.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:59: With Him are the keys of the unseen, the treasures that none knoweth but He.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:60: It is He who doth take your souls by night, and hath knowledge of all that ye have done by day: by day doth He raise you up again; that a term appointed be fulfilled; In the end unto Him will be your return; then will He show you the truth of all that ye did.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:61: He is the irresistible, (watching) from above over His worshippers, and He sets guardians over you.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:62: Then are men returned unto God, their protector, the (only) reality: Is not His the command? and He is the swiftest in taking account.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:63: Say: "Who is it that delivereth you from the dark recesses of land and sea, when ye call upon Him in humility and silent terror: ’If He only delivers us from these (dangers), (we vow) we shall truly show our gratitude’.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:64: Say "It is God that delivereth you from these and all (other) distresses: and yet ye worship false gods!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:65: Say: "He hath power to send calamities on you, from above and below, or to cover you with confusion in party strife, giving you a taste of mutual vengeance - each from the other.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:66: But thy people reject this, though it is the truth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:67: For every message is a limit of time, and soon shall ye know it.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:68: When thou seest men engaged in vain discourse about Our signs, turn away from them unless they turn to a different theme.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:69: On their account no responsibility falls on the righteous, but (their duty) is to remind them, that they may (learn to) fear God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:70: Leave alone those who take their religion to be mere play and amusement, and are deceived by the life of this world.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:71: Say: "Shall we indeed call on others besides God,- things that can do us neither good nor harm,- and turn on our heels after receiving guidance from God? - like one whom the evil ones have made into a fool, wandering bewildered through the earth, his friends calling, come to us’, (vainly) guiding him to the path.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:72: "To establish regular prayers and to fear God: for it is to Him that we shall be gathered together.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:73: It is He who created the heavens and the earth in true (proportions): the day He saith, "Be," behold! it is.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:74: Lo! Abraham said to his father Azar: "Takest thou idols for gods? For I see thee and thy people in manifest error.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:75: So also did We show Abraham the power and the laws of the heavens and the earth, that he might (with understanding) have certitude.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:76: When the night covered him over, He saw a star: He said: "This is my Lord.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:77: When he saw the moon rising in splendour, he said: "This is my Lord.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:78: When he saw the sun rising in splendour, he said: "This is my Lord; this is the greatest (of all).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:79: "For me, I have set my face, firmly and truly, towards Him Who created the heavens and the earth, and never shall I give partners to God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:81: "How should I fear (the beings) ye associate with God, when ye fear not to give partners to God without any warrant having been given to you? Which of (us) two parties hath more right to security? (tell me) if ye know.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:82: "It is those who believe and confuse not their beliefs with wrong - that are (truly) in security, for they are on (right) guidance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:83: That was the reasoning about Us, which We gave to Abraham (to use) against his people: We raise whom We will, degree after degree: for thy Lord is full of wisdom and knowledge.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:84: We gave him Isaac and Jacob: all (three) guided: and before him, We guided Noah, and among his progeny, David, Solomon, Job, Joseph, Moses, and Aaron: thus do We reward those who do good:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:85: And Zakariya and John, and Jesus and Elias: all in the ranks of the righteous:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:86: And Isma’il and Elisha, and Jonas, and Lot: and to all We gave favour above the nations:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:87: (To them) and to their fathers, and progeny and brethren: We chose them, and we guided them to a straight way.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:88: This is the guidance of God: He giveth that guidance to whom He pleaseth, of His worshippers.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:89: These were the men to whom We gave the Book, and authority, and prophethood: if these (their descendants) reject them, Behold! We shall entrust their charge to a new people who reject them not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:90: Those were the (prophets) who received God’s guidance: Copy the guidance they received; Say: "No reward for this do I ask of you: This is no less than a message for the nations.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:91: No just estimate of God do they make when they say: "Nothing doth God send down to man (by way of revelation)" Say: "Who then sent down the Book which Moses brought?- a light and guidance to man: But ye make it into (separate) sheets for show, while ye conceal much (of its contents): therein were ye taught that which ye knew not- neither ye nor your fathers.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:92: And this is a Book which We have sent down, bringing blessings, and confirming (the revelations) which came before it: that thou mayest warn the mother of cities and all around her.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:93: Who can be more wicked than one who inventeth a lie against God, or saith, "I have received inspiration," when he hath received none, or (again) who saith, "I can reveal the like of what God hath revealed"? If thou couldst but see how the wicked (do fare) in the flood of confusion at death! - the angels stretch forth their hands, (saying),"Yield up your souls: this day shall ye receive your reward,- a penalty of shame, for that ye used to tell lies against God, and scornfully to reject of His signs!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:94: "And behold! ye come to us bare and alone as We created you for the first time: ye have left behind you all (the favours) which We bestowed on you: We see not with you your intercessors whom ye thought to be partners in your affairs: so now all relations between you have been cut off, and your (pet) fancies have left you in the lurch!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:95: It is God Who causeth the seed-grain and the date-stone to split and sprout.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:96: He it is that cleaveth the day-break (from the dark): He makes the night for rest and tranquillity, and the sun and moon for the reckoning (of time): Such is the judgment and ordering of (Him), the Exalted in Power, the Omniscient.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:97: It is He Who maketh the stars (as beacons) for you, that ye may guide yourselves, with their help, through the dark spaces of land and sea: We detail Our signs for people who know.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:98: It is He Who hath produced you from a single person: here is a place of sojourn and a place of departure: We detail Our signs for people who understand.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:99: It is He Who sendeth down rain from the skies: with it We produce vegetation of all kinds: from some We produce green (crops), out of which We produce grain, heaped up (at harvest); out of the date-palm and its sheaths (or spathes) (come) clusters of dates hanging low and near: and (then there are) gardens of grapes, and olives, and pomegranates, each similar (in kind) yet different (in variety): when they begin to bear fruit, feast your eyes with the fruit and the ripeness thereof.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:100: Yet they make the Jinns equals with God, though God did create the Jinns; and they falsely, having no knowledge, attribute to Him sons and daughters.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:101: To Him is due the primal origin of the heavens and the earth: How can He have a son when He hath no consort? He created all things, and He hath full knowledge of all things.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:102: That is God, your Lord! there is no god but He, the Creator of all things: then worship ye Him: and He hath power to dispose of all affairs.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:103: No vision can grasp Him, but His grasp is over all vision: He is above all comprehension, yet is acquainted with all things.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:104: "Now have come to you, from your Lord, proofs (to open your eyes): if any will see, it will be for (the good of) his own soul; if any will be blind, it will be to his own (harm): I am not (here) to watch over your doings.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:105: Thus do we explain the signs by various (symbols): that they may say, "Thou hast taught (us) diligently," and that We may make the matter clear to those who know.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:106: Follow what thou art taught by inspiration from thy Lord: there is no god but He: and turn aside from those who join gods with God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:107: If it had been God’s plan, they would not have taken false gods: but We made thee not one to watch over their doings, nor art thou set over them to dispose of their affairs.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:108: Revile not ye those whom they call upon besides God, lest they out of spite revile God in their ignorance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:109: They swear their strongest oaths by God, that if a (special) sign came to them, by it they would believe.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:110: We (too) shall turn to (confusion) their hearts and their eyes, even as they refused to believe in this in the first instance: We shall leave them in their trespasses, to wander in distraction.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:111: Even if We did send unto them angels, and the dead did speak unto them, and We gathered together all things before their very eyes, they are not the ones to believe, unless it is in God’s plan.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:112: Likewise did We make for every Messenger an enemy,- evil ones among men and jinns, inspiring each other with flowery discourses by way of deception.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:113: To such (deceit) let the hearts of those incline, who have no faith in the hereafter: let them delight in it, and let them earn from it what they may.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:114: Say: "Shall I seek for judge other than God? - when He it is Who hath sent unto you the Book, explained in detail.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:115: The word of thy Lord doth find its fulfilment in truth and in justice: None can change His words: for He is the one who heareth and knoweth all.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:116: Wert thou to follow the common run of those on earth, they will lead thee away from the way of God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:117: Thy Lord knoweth best who strayeth from His way: He knoweth best who they are that receive His guidance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:118: So eat of (meats) on which God’s name hath been pronounced, if ye have faith in His signs.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:119: Why should ye not eat of (meats) on which God’s name hath been pronounced, when He hath explained to you in detail what is forbidden to you - except under compulsion of necessity? But many do mislead (men) by their appetites unchecked by knowledge.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:120: Eschew all sin, open or secret: those who earn sin will get due recompense for their "earnings.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:121: Eat not of (meats) on which God’s name hath not been pronounced: That would be impiety.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:122: Can he who was dead, to whom We gave life, and a light whereby he can walk amongst men, be like him who is in the depths of darkness, from which he can never come out? Thus to those without faith their own deeds seem pleasing.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:123: Thus have We placed leaders in every town, its wicked men, to plot (and burrow) therein: but they only plot against their own souls, and they perceive it not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:124: When there comes to them a sign (from God), They say: "We shall not believe until we receive one (exactly) like those received by God’s apostles.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:125: Those whom God (in His plan) willeth to guide,- He openeth their breast to Islam; those whom He willeth to leave straying,- He maketh their breast close and constricted, as if they had to climb up to the skies: thus doth God (heap) the penalty on those who refuse to believe.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:126: This is the way of thy Lord, leading straight: We have detailed the signs for those who receive admonition.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:127: For them will be a home of peace in the presence of their Lord: He will be their friend, because they practised (righteousness).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:128: One day will He gather them all together, (and say): "O ye assembly of Jinns! Much (toll) did ye take of men.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:129: Thus do we make the wrong-doers turn to each other, because of what they earn.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:130: "O ye assembly of Jinns and men! came there not unto you apostles from amongst you, setting forth unto you My signs, and warning you of the meeting of this Day of yours?" They will say: "We bear witness against ourselves.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:131: (The apostles were sent) thus, for thy Lord would not destroy for their wrong-doing men’s habitations whilst their occupants were unwarned.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:132: To all are degrees (or ranks) according to their deeds: for thy Lord is not unmindful of anything that they do.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:133: Thy Lord is self-sufficient, full of Mercy: if it were His will, He could destroy you, and in your place appoint whom He will as your successors, even as He raised you up from the posterity of other people.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:134: All that hath been promised unto you will come to pass: nor can ye frustrate it (in the least bit).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:135: Say: "O my people! Do whatever ye can: I will do (my part): soon will ye know who it is whose end will be (best) in the Hereafter: certain it is that the wrong-doers will not prosper.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:136: Out of what God hath produced in abundance in tilth and in cattle, they assigned Him a share: they say, according to their fancies: "This is for God, and this" - for our "partners"! but the share of their" partners "reacheth not God, whilst the share of God reacheth their "partners" ! evil (and unjust) is their assignment!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:137: Even so, in the eyes of most of the pagans, their "partners" made alluring the slaughter of their children, in order to lead them to their own destruction, and cause confusion in their religion.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:138: And they say that such and such cattle and crops are taboo, and none should eat of them except those whom - so they say - We wish; further, there are cattle forbidden to yoke or burden, and cattle on which, (at slaughter), the name of God is not pronounced; - inventions against God’s name: soon will He requite them for their inventions.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:139: They say: "What is in the wombs of such and such cattle is specially reserved (for food) for our men, and forbidden to our women; but if it is still-born, then all have share therein.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:140: Lost are those who slay their children, from folly, without knowledge, and forbid food which God hath provided for them, inventing (lies) against God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:141: It is He Who produceth gardens, with trellises and without, and dates, and tilth with produce of all kinds, and olives and pomegranates, similar (in kind) and different (in variety): eat of their fruit in their season, but render the dues that are proper on the day that the harvest is gathered.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:142: Of the cattle are some for burden and some for meat: eat what God hath provided for you, and follow not the footsteps of Satan: for he is to you and avowed enemy.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:143: (Take) eight (head of cattle) in (four) pairs: of sheep a pair, and of goats a pair; say, hath He forbidden the two males, or the two females, or (the young) which the wombs of the two females enclose? Tell me with knowledge if ye are truthful:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:144: Of camels a pair, and oxen a pair; say, hath He forbidden the two males, or the two females, or (the young) which the wombs of the two females enclose? - Were ye present when God ordered you such a thing? But who doth more wrong than one who invents a lie against God, to lead astray men without knowledge? For God guideth not people who do wrong.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:145: Say: "I find not in the message received by me by inspiration any (meat) forbidden to be eaten by one who wishes to eat it, unless it be dead meat, or blood poured forth, or the flesh of swine,- for it is an abomination - or, what is impious, (meat) on which a name has been invoked, other than God’s".
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:146: For those who followed the Jewish Law, We forbade every (animal) with undivided hoof, and We forbade them that fat of the ox and the sheep, except what adheres to their backs or their entrails, or is mixed up with a bone: this in recompense for their wilful disobedience: for We are true (in Our ordinances).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:147: If they accuse thee of falsehood, say: "Your Lord is full of mercy all-embracing; but from people in guilt never will His wrath be turned back.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:148: Those who give partners (to God) will say: "If God had wished, we should not have given partners to Him nor would our fathers; nor should we have had any taboos.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:149: Say: "With God is the argument that reaches home: if it had been His will, He could indeed have guided you all.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:150: Say: "Bring forward your witnesses to prove that God did forbid so and so.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:151: Say: "Come, I will rehearse what God hath (really) prohibited you from": Join not anything as equal with Him; be good to your parents; kill not your children on a plea of want;- We provide sustenance for you and for them;- come not nigh to shameful deeds.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:152: And come not nigh to the orphan’s property, except to improve it, until he attain the age of full strength; give measure and weight with (full) justice;- no burden do We place on any soul, but that which it can bear;- whenever ye speak, speak justly, even if a near relative is concerned; and fulfil the covenant of God: thus doth He command you, that ye may remember.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:153: Verily, this is My way, leading straight: follow it: follow not (other) paths: they will scatter you about from His (great) path: thus doth He command you.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:154: Moreover, We gave Moses the Book, completing (Our favour) to those who would do right, and explaining all things in detail,- and a guide and a mercy, that they might believe in the meeting with their Lord.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:155: And this is a Book which We have revealed as a blessing: so follow it and be righteous, that ye may receive mercy:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:156: Lest ye should say: "The Book was sent down to two Peoples before us, and for our part, we remained unacquainted with all that they learned by assiduous study:"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:157: Or lest ye should say: "If the Book had only been sent down to us, we should have followed its guidance better than they.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:158: Are they waiting to see if the angels come to them, or thy Lord (Himself), or certain of the signs of thy Lord! the day that certain of the signs of thy Lord do come, no good will it do to a soul to believe in them then if it believed not before nor earned righteousness through its faith.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:159: As for those who divide their religion and break up into sects, thou hast no part in them in the least: their affair is with God: He will in the end tell them the truth of all that they did.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:160: He that doeth good shall have ten times as much to his credit: He that doeth evil shall only be recompensed according to his evil: no wrong shall be done unto (any of) them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:161: Say: "Verily, my Lord hath guided me to a way that is straight,- a religion of right,- the path (trod) by Abraham the true in Faith, and he (certainly) joined not gods with God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:162: Say: "Truly, my prayer and my service of sacrifice, my life and my death, are (all) for God, the Cherisher of the Worlds:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:163: No partner hath He: this am I commanded, and I am the first of those who bow to His will.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:164: Say: "Shall I seek for (my) Cherisher other than God, when He is the Cherisher of all things (that exist)? Every soul draws the meed of its acts on none but itself: no bearer of burdens can bear of burdens can bear the burden of another.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 6:165: It is He Who hath made you (His) agents, inheritors of the earth: He hath raised you in ranks, some above others: that He may try you in the gifts He hath given you: for thy Lord is quick in punishment: yet He is indeed Oft-forgiving, Most Merciful.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:1: Praise belongs to God who created the heavens and the earth and appointed the shadows and light; then the unbelievers ascribe equals to their Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:2: It is He who created you of clay, then determined a term and a term is stated with Him; yet thereafter you doubt.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:3: He is God in the heavens and the earth; He knows your secrets, and what you publish, and He knows what you are earning.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:4: Not a sign of their Lord comes to them, but they turn away from it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:5: They cried lies to the truth when it came to them, but there shall come to them news of that they were mocking.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:6: Have they not regarded how We destroyed before them many a generation We established in the earth, as We never established you, and how We loosed heaven upon them in torrents, and made the rivers to flow beneath them? Then We destroyed them because of their sins, and raised up after them another generation;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:7: Had We sent down on thee a Book on parchment and so they touched it with their hands, yet the unbelievers would have said, ’This is naught but manifest sorcery.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:8: ’Why has an angel not been sent down on him?’ they say; yet had We sent down an angel, the matter would have been determined, and then no respite would be given them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:9: And had We made him an angel, yet assuredly We would have made him a man, and confused for them the thing which they themselves are confusing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:10: Messengers indeed were mocked at before thee; but those that scoffed at them were encompassed by that they mocked at.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:11: Say: ’Journey in the land, then behold how was the end of them that cried lies.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:12: Say: ’To whom belongs what is in the heavens and in the earth?’ Say: ’It is God’s.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:13: And to Him belongs whatsoever inhabits the night and the day; and He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:14: Say: ’Shall I take to myself as protector other than God, the Originator of the heavens and of the earth, He.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:15: Say: ’Indeed I fear, if I should rebel against thy Lord, the chastisement of a dreadful day.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:16: From whomsoever it is averted on that day, He will have mercy on him; that is the manifest triumph.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:17: And if God visits thee with affliction none can remove it but He; and if He visits thee with good, He is powerful over everything.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:18: He is Omnipotent over His servants, and He is the All-wise, the All-aware.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:19: Say: ’God is witness between me and you, and this Koran has been revealed to me that I may warn you thereby, and whomsoever it may reach.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:20: Those to whom We have given the Book recognize it as they recognize their sons.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:21: And who does greater evil than he who forges against God a lie, or cries lies to His signs? They shall not prosper, the evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:22: And on the day when We shall muster them all together, then We shall say unto those who associated other gods with God, ’Where are your associates whom you were asserting?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:23: Then they shall have no proving, but to say, ’By God our Lord, we never associated other gods with Thee.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:24: Behold how they lie against themselves, and how that which they were forging has gone astray from them!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:25: And some of them there are that listen to thee, and We lay veils upon their hearts lest they understand it, and in their ears heaviness; and if they see any sign whatever, they do not believe in it, so that when they come to thee they dispute with thee, the unbelievers saying, ’This is naught but the fairy-tales of the ancient ones.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:26: And they forbid it, and keep afar from it, and it is only themselves they destroy, but they are not aware.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:27: If thou couldst see when they are stationed before the Fire, and they say, ’Would that we might be returned, and then not cry lies to the signs of our Lord, but that we might be among the believers!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:28: No; that which they were concealing before has now appeared to them; and even if they were returned, they would again commit the very thing they were prohibited; they are truly liars.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:29: And they say, ’There is only our present life; we shall not be raised.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:30: If thou couldst see when they are stationed before their Lord! He will say, ’Is not this the truth?’ They will say, ’Yes indeed, by our Lord!’ He will say, ’Then taste the chastisement for your unbelief.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:31: Lost indeed are they that cried lies to the encounter with God, so that when the Hour comes to them suddenly they shall say, ’Alas for us, that we neglected it!’ On their backs they shall be bearing their loads; O how evil the loads they bear!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:32: The present life is naught but a sport and a diversion; surely the Last Abode is better for those that are godfearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:33: We know indeed that it grieves thee the things they say; yet it is not thee they cry lies to, but the evildoers - it is the signs of God that they deny.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:34: Messengers indeed were cried lies to before thee, yet they endured patiently that they were cried lies to, and were hurt, until Our help came unto them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:35: And if their turning away is distressful for thee, why, if thou canst seek out a hole in the earth, or a ladder in heaven, to bring them some sign but had God willed, He would have gathered them to the guidance; so be not thou one of the ignorant.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:36: Answer only will those who hear; as for the dead, God will raise them up, then unto Him they will be returned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:37: They also say, ’Why has no sign been sent down upon him from his Lord?’ Say: ’Surely God is able to send down a sign, but most of them know not.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:38: No creature is there crawling on the earth, no bird flying with its wings, but they are nations like unto yourselves.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:39: And those who cry lies to Our signs are deaf and dumb, dwelling in the shadows.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:40: Say: ’What think you? If God’s chastisement comes upon you, or the Hour comes upon you, will you call upon any other than God if you speak truly?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:41: No; upon Him you will call, and He will remove that for which you call upon Him if He Will, and you will forget that you associate with Him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:42: Indeed We sent to nations before thee, and We seized them with misery and hardship that haply they might be humble;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:43: if only, when Our might came upon them, they had been humble! But their hearts were hard, and Satan decked out fair to them what they were doing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:44: So, when they forgot what they were reminded of; We opened unto them the gates of everything until; when they rejoiced in what they were given, We seized them suddenly, and behold, they were sore confounded.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:45: So the last remnant of the people who did evil was cut off.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:46: Say: ’What think you? If God seizes your hearing and sight, and sets a seal upon your hearts, who is a god other than God to give it back to you?’ Behold how We turn about the signs! Yet thereafter they are turning away.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:47: Say: ’What think you? If God’s chastisement comes upon you, suddenly or openly, shall any be destroyed, except the people of the evildoers?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:48: We do not send the Envoys, except good tidings to bear, and warning; whoever believes and makes amends -- no fear shall be on them, neither shall they sorrow.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:49: But those who cry lies to Our signs, them the chastisement shall visit, for that they were ungodly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:50: Say: ’I do not say to you, "I possess the treasuries of God"; I know not the Unseen.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:51: And warn therewith those who fear they shall be mustered to their Lord; they have, apart from God, no protector and no intercessor; haply they will be godfearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:52: And do not drive away those who call upon their Lord at morning and evening desiring His countenance; nothing of their account falls upon thee, and nothing of thy account falls upon them, that thou shouldst drive them away, and so become one of the evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:53: Even so We have tried some of them by others that they may say, Are these the ones God has been gracious to among us?’ Knows not God very well the thankful?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:54: And when those who believe in Our signs come to thee, say, ’Peace be upon you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:55: Thus We distinguish Our signs, that the sinners’ way may be manifest.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:56: Say: ’I am forbidden to serve those you call on apart from God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:57: Say: ’I stand upon a clear sign from my Lord, and you have cried lies to it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:58: Say: ’If what you seek to hasten were with me, the matter between you and me would be decided; and God knows very well the evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:59: With Him are the keys of the Unseen; none knows them but He.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:60: It is He who recalls you by night, and He knows what you work by day; then He raises you up therein, that a stated term may be determined; then unto Him shall you return, then He will tell you of what you have been doing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:61: He is the Omnipotent over His servants.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:62: Then they are restored to God their Protector, the True.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:63: Say: ’Who delivers you from the shadows of land and sea? You call upon Him humbly and secretly, "Truly, if Thou deliverest from these, we shall be among the thankful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:64: Say: ’God delivers you from them and from every distress; then you assign Him associates.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:65: Say: ’He is able to send forth upon you chastisement, from above you or from under your feet, or to confuse you in sects and to make you taste the violence of one another.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:66: Thy people have cried it lies; yet it is the truth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:67: Every tiding has its time appointed; you will surely know.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:68: When thou seest those who plunge into Our signs, turn away from them until they plunge into some other talk; or if Satan should make thee forget, do not sit, after the reminding, with the people of the evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:69: Nothing of their account falls upon those that are godfearing; but a reminding; haply they will be godfearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:70: Leave alone those who take their religion for a sport and a diversion, and whom the present life has deluded.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:71: Say: ’Shall we call, apart from God, on that which neither profits nor hurts us, and shall we be turned back on our heels after that God has guided us? -- Like one lured to bewilderment in the earth by Satans, though he has friends who call him to guidance, "Come to us!" Say: ’God’s guidance is the true guidance, and we are commanded to surrender to the Lord of all Being,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:72: and: "Perform the prayer, and fear Him; it is unto Him you shall be mustered.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:73: It is He who created the heavens and the earth in truth; and the day He says ’Be’, and it is; His saying is true, and His is the Kingdom the day the Trumpet is blown; He is Knower of the Unseen and the visible; He is the All-wise, the All-aware.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:74: And when Abraham said to his father Azar, ’Takest thou idols for gods? I see thee, and thy people, in manifest error.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:75: So We were showing Abraham the kingdom of the heavens and earth, that he might be of those having sure faith.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:76: When night outspread over him he saw a star and said, ’This is my Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:77: When he saw the moon rising, he said, ’This is my Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:78: When he saw the sun rising, he said, ’This is my Lord; this is greater!’ But when it set he said, ’O my people, surely I am quit of that you associate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:79: I have turned my face to Him who originated the heavens and the earth, a man of pure faith; I am not of the idolaters.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:81: How should I fear what you have associated, seeing you fear not that you have associated with God that whereon He has not sent down on you any authority?’ Which of the two parties has better title to security, if you have any knowledge?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:82: Those who believe, and have not confounded their belief with evildoing -- to them belongs the true security; they are rightly guided.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:83: That is Our argument, which We bestowed upon Abraham as against his people.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:84: And We gave to him Isaac and Jacob -- each one We guided, And Noah We guided before; and of his seed David and Solomon, Job and Joseph, Moses and Aaron -- even so We recompense the good-doers --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:85: Zachariah and John, Jesus and Elias; each was of the righteous;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:86: Ishmael and Elisha, Jonah and Lot-each one We preferred above all beings;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:87: and of their fathers, and of their seed, and of their brethren; and We elected them, and We guided them to a straight path.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:88: That is God’s guidance; He guides by it whom He will of His servants; had they been idolaters, it would have failed them, the things they did.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:89: Those are they to whom We gave the Book, the Judgment, the Prophethood; so if these disbelieve in it, We have already entrusted it to a people who do not disbelieve in it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:90: Those are they whom God has guided; so follow their guidance.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:91: They measured not God with His true measure when they said, ’God has not sent down aught on any mortal.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:92: This is a Book We have sent down, blessed and confirming that which was before it, and for thee to warn the Mother of Cities and those about her; and those who believe in the world to come believe in it, and watch over their prayers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:93: And who does greater evil than he who forges against God a lie, or says,, ’To me it has been revealed’, when naught has been revealed to him, or he who says, ’I will send down the like of what God has sent down’? If thou couldst only see when the evildoers are in the agonies of death, and the angels are stretching out their hands: ’Give up your souls! Today you shall be recompensed with the chastisement of humiliation for what you said untruly about God, waxing proud against His signs.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:94: ’Now you have come to Us one by one, as We created you upon the first time, and you have left what We conferred on you behind your backs.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:95: It is God who splits the grain and the date-stone, brings forth the living from the dead; He brings forth the dead too from the living.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:96: He splits the sky into dawn, and has made the night for a repose, and the sun and moon for a reckoning.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:97: It is He who has appointed for you the stars, that by them you might be guided in the shadows of land and sea.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:98: It is He who produced you from one living soul, and then a lodging-place, and then a repository.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:99: It is He who sent down out of heaven water, and thereby We have brought forth the shoot of every plant, and then We have brought forth the green leaf of it, bringing forth from it close-compounded grain, and out of the palm-tree, from the spathe of it, dates thick-lustered, ready to the hand, and gardens of vines, olives, pomegranates, like each to each, and each unlike to each.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:100: Yet they ascribe to God, as associates, the jinn, though He created them; and they impute to Him sons and daughters without any knowledge.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:101: The Creator of the heavens and the earth -- how should He have a son, seeing that He has no consort, and He created all things, and He has knowledge of everything?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:102: That then is God your Lord; there is no god but He, the Creator of everything.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:103: The eyes attain Him not, but He attains the eyes; He is the All-subtle, the All-aware.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:104: Clear proofs have come to you from your Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:105: So We turn about the signs, that they may say, ’Thou hast studied’; and that We may make it clear to a people having knowledge.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:106: Follow thou what has been revealed to thee from thy Lord; there is no god but He; and turn thou away from the idolaters.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:107: Had God willed, they were not idolaters; and We have not appointed thee a watcher over them, neither art thou their guardian.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:108: Abuse not those to whom they pray, apart from God, or they will abuse God in revenge without knowledge.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:109: They have sworn by God the most earnest oaths if a sign comes to them they will believe in it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:110: We shall turn about their hearts and their eyes, even as they believed not in it the first time; and We shall leave them in their insolence wandering blindly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:111: Though We had sent down the angels to them, and the dead had spoken with them, had We mustered against them every thing, face to face, yet they would not have been the ones to believe, unless God willed; but most of them are ignorant.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:112: So We have appointed to every Prophet an enemy -- Satans of men and jinn, revealing tawdry speech to each other, all as a delusion; yet, had thy Lord willed, they would never have done it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:113: and that the hearts of those who believe not in the world to come may incline to it, and that they may be well-pleased with it, and that they may gain what they are gaining.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:114: What, shall I seek after any judge but God? For it is He who sent down to you the Book well-distinguished; and those whom We have given the Book know it is sent down from thy Lord with the truth; so be not thou of the doubters.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:115: Perfect are the words of thy Lord in truthfulness and justice; no man can change His words; He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:116: If thou obeyest the most part of those on earth they will lead thee astray from the path of God; they follow only surmise, merely conjecturing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:117: Thy Lord knows very well who goes astray from His path; He knows very well the right-guided.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:118: Eat of that over which God’s Name has been mentioned, if you believe in His signs.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:119: How is it with you, that you do not eat of that over which God’s Name has been mentioned, seeing that He has distinguished for you that He has forbidden you, unless you are constrained to it? But surely, many lead astray by their caprices, without any knowledge; thy Lord knows very well the transgressors.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:120: Forsake the outward sin, and the inward surely the earners of sin shall be recompensed for what they have earned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:121: And eat not of that over which God’s Name has not been mentioned; it is ungodliness.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:122: Why, is he who was dead, and We gave him life, and appointed for him a light to walk by among the people as one whose likeness is in the shadows, and comes not forth from them? So it is decked out fair to the unbelievers the things they have done.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:123: And even so We appointed in every city great ones among its sinners, to devise there; but they devised only against themselves, and they were not aware.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:124: And when a sign came to them, they said, ’We will not believe until we are given the like of what God’s Messengers were given.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:125: Whomsoever God desires to guide, He expands his breast to Islam; whomsoever He desires to lead astray, He makes his breast narrow, tight, as if he were climbing to heaven.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:126: This is the path of thy Lord; straight; We have distinguished the signs to a people who remember.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:127: Theirs is the abode of peace with their Lord, and He is their Protector for that they were doing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:128: On the day when He shall muster them all together: ’Company of jinn, you have made much of mankind.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:129: So We make the evildoers friends of each other for what they have earned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:130: ’Company of jinn and mankind, did not Messengers come to you from among you, relating to you My signs and warning you of the encounter of this your day?’ They shall say, ’We bear witness against ourselves.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:131: That is because thy Lord would never destroy the cities unjustly, while their inhabitants were heedless.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:132: All have degrees according to what they have done; thy Lord is not heedless of the things they do.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:134: The thing you are promised, that will surely come; you cannot frustrate it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:135: Say: ’O my people, act according to your station; I am acting.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:136: They appoint to God, of the tillage and cattle that He multiplied, a portion, saying, ’This is for God’ -- so they assert -- ’and this is for our associates.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:137: Thus those associates of theirs have decked out fair to many idolaters to slay their children, to destroy them, and to confuse their religion for them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:138: They say, ’These are cattle and tillage sacrosanct; none shall eat them, but whom we will’-- so they assert -- ’and cattle whose backs have been forbidden, and cattle over which they mention not the Name of God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:139: And they say, ’What is within the bellies of these cattle is reserved for our males and forbidden to our spouses; but if it be dead, then they all shall be partners in it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:140: Losers are they who slay their children in folly, without knowledge, and have forbidden what God has provided them, forging against God; they have gone astray, and are not right-guided.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:141: It is He who produces gardens trellised, and untrellised, palm-trees, and crops diverse in produce, olives, pomegranates, like each to each, and each unlike to each.
