Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:142: And of the cattle, for burthen and for slaughter, eat of what God has provided you; and follow not the steps of Satan; he is a manifest foe to you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:143: Eight couples: two of sheep, of goats two.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:144: Of camels two, of oxen two.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:145: Say: ’I do not find, in what is revealed to me, aught forbidden to him who eats thereof except it be carrion, or blood outpoured, or the flesh of swine -- that is an abomination -- or an ungodly thing that has been hallowed to other than God; yet whoso is constrained, not desiring nor transgressing, surely thy Lord is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:146: And to those of Jewry We have forbidden every beast with claws; and of oxen and sheep We have forbidden them the fat of them, save what their backs carry, or their entrails, or what is mingled with bone; that We recompensed them for their insolence; surely We speak truly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:147: So, if they cry thee lies, say: ’Your Lord is of mercy all-embracing, and His might will never be turned back from the people of the sinners.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:148: The idolaters will say, ’Had God willed, we would not have been idolaters, neither our fathers, nor would we have forbidden aught.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:149: Say: ’To God belongs the argument conclusive; for had He willed, He would have guided you all.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:150: Say: ’Produce your witnesses, those who testify God has forbidden this.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:151: Say: ’Come, I will recite what your Lord has forbidden you: that you associate not anything with Him, and to be good to your parents, and not to slay your children because of poverty; We will provide you and them and that you approach not any indecency outward or inward, and that you slay not the soul God has forbidden, except by right.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:152: And that you approach not the property of the orphan, save in the fairer manner, until he is of age.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:153: And that this is My path, straight; so do you follow it, and follow not divers paths lest they scatter you from His path.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:154: Then We gave Moses the Book, complete for him who does good, and distinguishing every thing, and as a guidance and a mercy; haply they would believe in the encounter with their Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:155: This is a Book We have sent down, blessed; so follow it, and be godfearing; haply so you will find mercy;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:156: lest you should say, ’The Book was sent down only upon two parties before us, and we have indeed been heedless of their study’;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:157: or lest you say, ’If the Book had been sent down upon us, we had surely been more rightly guided than they.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:158: What, do they look for the angels to come to them, nothing less, or that thy Lord should come, or that one of thy Lord’s signs should come? On the day that one of thy Lord’s signs comes it shall not profit a soul to believe that never believed before, or earned some good in his belief.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:159: Those who have made divisions in their religion and become sects, thou art not of them in anything; their affair is unto God, then He will tell them what they have been doing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:160: Whoso brings a good deed shall have ten the like of it; and whoso brings an evil deed shall only be recompensed the like of it; they shall not be wronged.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:161: Say: ’As for me, my Lord has guided me to a straight path, a right religion, the creed of Abraham, a man of pure faith; he was no idolater.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:162: Say: ’My prayer, my ritual sacrifice, my living, my dying -- all belongs to God, the Lord of all Being.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:164: Say: ’Shall I seek after a Lord other than God, who is the Lord of all things?’ Every soul earns only to its own account, no soul laden bears the load of another.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 6:165: It is He who has appointed you viceroys in the earth, and has raised some of you in rank above others, that He may try you in what He has given you.

Muhammad Asad.verse 6:1: ALL PRAISE is due to God, who has created the heavens and the earth, and brought into being deep darkness as well as light: and yet, those who are bent on denying the truth regard other powers as their Sustainer’s equals!
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:2: He it is who has created you out of clay, and then has decreed a term [for you] – a term known
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:4: although He is God in the heavens and on earth, knowing all that you keep secret as well as all that you do openly, and knowing what you deserve.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:5: Yet whenever any of their Sustainer’s messages comes unto them, they [who are bent on denying the truth] turn their backs upon it:
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:6: and so they give the lie to this truth now that it has come unto them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:7: Do they not see how many a generation We have destroyed before their time –
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:9: place on earth, the like of which We never gave unto you, and upon whom We showered heavenly blessings abundant, and at whose feet We made running waters flow? And yet We destroyed them for their sins, and gave rise to other people in their stead.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:10: But even if We had sent down unto thee [O Prophet] a writing on paper, and they had touched it with their own hands – those who are bent on denying the truth would indeed have said, "This is clearly nothing but a deception!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:11: They are saying, too, "Why has not an angel
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:12: been sent down unto him?" But had We sent down an angel, all would indeed have been decided, and they would have been allowed no further respite [for repentance].
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:14: if We had appointed an angel as Our message-bearer, We would certainly have made him [appear as] a man – and thus We would only have confused them in the same way as they are now confusing themselves.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:16: before thy time have apostles been derided – but those who scoffed at them were [in the end] overwhelmed by the very thing which they were wont to deride.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:17: Say: "Go all over the earth, and behold what happened in the end to those who gave the lie to the truth!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:18: Say: "Unto whom belongs all that is in the heavens and on earth?" Say: "Unto God, who has willed upon Himself the law of grace and mercy.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:19: although His is all that dwells in the night and the day, and He alone is all-hearing, all-knowing.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:20: Say: "Am I to take for my master anyone but God, the Originator of the heavens and the earth, when it is He who gives nourishment and Himself needs none?" Say: "I am bidden to be foremost among those who surrender themselves unto God, and not to be among those who ascribe divinity to aught beside Him.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:21: Say: "Behold, I would dread, were I
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:22: to rebel against my Sustainer, the suffering [which would befall me] on that awesome Day [of Judgment].
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:23: Upon him who shall be spared on that Day, He will indeed have bestowed His grace: and this will be a manifest triumph.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:24: And if God should touch thee with misfortune, there is none who could remove it but He; and if He should touch thee with good fortune – it is He who has the power to will anything:
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:25: for He alone holds sway over His creatures, and He alone is truly wise, all-aware.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:26: Say: "What could most weightily bear witness to the truth?" Say: "God is witness between me and you; and this Qur’ān has been revealed unto me so that on the strength thereof I might warn you and all whom it may reach.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:27: witness!" Say: "He is the One God; and, behold, far be it from me to ascribe divinity, as you do, to aught beside Him!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:28: They unto whom We have vouchsafed revelation aforetime know this as they know their own children; yet those [of them] who have squandered their own selves – it is they who refuse to believe.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:29: And who could be more wicked than he who attributes his own lying inventions to God or gives the lie to His messages? Verily, such evildoers will never attain to a happy state:
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:30: for one Day We shall gather them all together, and then We shall say unto those who ascribed divinity to aught beside God: "Where, now, are those beings whom you imagined to have a share in God’s divinity?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:31: Whereupon, in their utter confusion, they will only [be able to] say: "By God, our Sustainer, we did not [mean to] ascribe divinity to aught beside Him!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:32: Behold how they have lied to themselves – and
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:33: their false imagery has forsaken them!
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:34: And there are among them such as [seem to] listen to thee [O Prophet]: but over their hearts We have laid veils which prevent them from grasping the truth, and into their ears, deafness.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:35: And they bar others therefrom, and go far away from it: but they destroy none but themselves, and perceive it not.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:37: when they will be made to stand before the fire and will say, "Oh, would that we were brought back [to life]: then we would not give the lie to our Sustainer’s messages, but would be among the believers!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:38: But nay – [they will say this only because] the truth which they used to conceal [from themselves] in the past will have become obvious to them; and if they were brought back [to life], they would return to the very thing which was forbidden to them: for, behold, they are indeed liars!
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:39: And some [of the unbelievers] say, "There is nothing beyond our life in this world, for We shall not be raised from the dead.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:41: when they shall be made to stand before their Sustainer
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:42: He will say, "Is not this the truth?" They will answer: "Yea, indeed, by our Sustainer!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:43: He will say: "Taste, then, the suffering that comes from your having refused to acknowledge the truth!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:44: Lost indeed are they who consider it a lie that they will have to meet God – till the Last Hour suddenly comes upon them,
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:45: they cry, "Alas for us, that we disregarded it!" – for they shall bear on their backs the burden of their sins: oh, how evil the load with which they shall be burdened!
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:46: And nothing is the life of this world but a play and a passing delight; and the life in the hereafter is by far the better for all who are conscious of God.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:47: Well do We know that what such people say grieves thee indeed: yet, behold, it is not thee to whom they give the lie, but God’s messages do these evildoers deny.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:49: before thy time have apostles been given the lie, and they endured with patience all those charges of falsehood, and all the hurt done to them, till succour came unto them from Us: for there is no power that could alter [the outcome of] God’s promises.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:50: And if it distress thee that those who deny the truth turn their backs on thee – why, then, if thou art able to go down deep into the earth or to ascend a ladder unto heaven in order to bring them a [yet more convincing] message, [do so;] but [remember that] had God so willed, He would indeed have gathered them all unto
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:52: Only they who listen [with their hearts] can respond to a call; and as for the dead [of heart], God
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:53: can raise them from the dead, whereupon unto Him they shall return.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:54: And they say, "Why has no miraculous sign been bestowed on him from on high by his Sustainer?" Say: "Behold, God has the power to bestow any sign from on high.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:55: although there is no beast that walks on earth and no bird that flies on its two wings which is not
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:56: creature like yourselves: no single thing have We neglected in Our decree.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:58: And they who give the lie to Our messages are deaf and dumb, in darkness deep.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:59: Say: "Can you see yourselves invoking any but God when God’s chastisement befalls you [in this world], or the Last Hour comes upon you? [Tell me this,] if you are men of truth!
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:60: Nay, but it is Him alone that you will invoke – whereupon He may, if He so wills, remove that
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:61: which caused you to call unto Him; and you will have forgotten all that to which you
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:62: ascribe divinity side by side with Him.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:63: And, indeed, We sent Our messages unto people before thy time, [O Prophet,] and visited them with misfortune and hardship so that they might humble themselves:
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:64: yet when the misfortune decreed by Us befell them, they did not humble themselves, but rather their hearts grew hard, for Satan had made all their doings seem goodly to them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:65: Then, when they had forgotten all that they had been told to take to heart, We threw open to them the gates of all
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:66: things, until – even as they were rejoicing in what they had been granted – We suddenly took them to task: and lo! they were broken in spirit;
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:67: and [in the end,] the last remnant of those folk who had been bent on evildoing was wiped out.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:68: Say: "What do you think? If God should take away your hearing and your sight and seal your hearts – what deity but God is there that could bring it all back to you?" Behold how many facets We give to Our messages – and yet they turn away in disdain!
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:69: Say: "Can you imagine what your condition will be if God’s chastisement befalls you, either suddenly or in a
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:70: perceptible manner? [But then –] will any but evildoing folk
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:73: message-bearers only as heralds of glad tidings and as warners: hence, all who believe and live righteously – no fear need they have, and neither shall they grieve;
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:74: whereas those who give the lie to Our messages – suffering will afflict them in result of all their sinful doings.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:75: Say [O Prophet]: "I do not say unto you, ‘God’s treasures are with me’; nor [do I say], ‘I know the things that are beyond the reach of human perception’; nor do I say unto you, ‘Behold, I am an angel’: I but follow what is revealed to me.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:76: And warn hereby those who fear lest they be gathered unto their Sustainer with none to protect them from Him or to intercede with Him, so that they might become
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:78: Hence, repulse not [any of] those who at morn and evening invoke their Sustainer, seeking His countenance.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:79: For it is in this way that We try men through one another – to the end that they might ask, "Has God, then, bestowed His favour upon those others in preference to us?" Does not God know best as to who is grateful [to Him]?
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:80: And when those who believe in Our messages come unto thee, say: "Peace be upon you.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:82: And thus clearly do We spell out Our messages: and [We do it] so that the path of those who are lost in sin might be distinct [from that of the righteous].
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:83: SAY [to the deniers of the truth]: "Behold, I have been forbidden to worship those
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:84: whom you invoke instead of God.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:85: Say: "Behold, I take my stand on a clear evidence from my Sustainer – and
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:86: it is to Him that you are giving the lie! Not in my power is that which [in your ignorance] you so hastily demand: judgment rests with none but God.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:87: Say: "If that which you so hastily demand were in my power, everything would indeed have been decided between me and you.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:88: For with Him are the keys to the things that are beyond the reach of a created being’s perception: none knows them but He.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:90: And He it is who causes you to be
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:91: dead at night, and knows what you work in daytime; and He brings you back to life each day in order that a term set [by Him] be fulfilled.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:92: And He alone holds sway over His servants.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:93: And they [who have died] are thereupon brought before God, their true Lord Supreme.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:94: Say: "Who is it that saves you from the dark dangers of land and sea
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:95: you call unto Him humbly, and in the secrecy of your hearts, ‘If He will but save us from this ,
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:96: we shall most certainly be among the grateful’?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:98: can save you from this and from every distress – and still you ascribe divinity to other powers beside Him!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:99: Say: "It is He alone who has the power to let loose upon you suffering from above you or from beneath your feet, or to confound you with mutual discord and let you taste the fear of one another.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:100: and yet, to all this thy people have given the lie, although it is the truth.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:101: "I am not responsible for your conduct.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:102: Every tiding [from God] has a term set for its fulfilment: and in time you will come to know [the truth].
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:103: NOW, whenever thou meet such as indulge in
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:104: talk about Our messages, turn thy back upon them until they begin to talk of other things; and if Satan should ever cause thee to forget ,
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:105: remain not, after recollection, in the company of such evildoing folk,
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:106: for whom those who are conscious of God are in no wise accountable.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:107: And leave to themselves all those who, beguiled by the life of this world, have made play and passing delights their religion; but remind
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:108: herewith that [in the life to come] every human being shall be held in pledge for whatever wrong he has done, and shall have none to protect him from God, and none to intercede for him; and though he offer any conceivable ransom, it shall not be accepted from him.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:109: SAY: "Shall we invoke, instead of God, something that can neither benefit us nor harm us, and
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:110: turn around on our heels after God has guided us aright? – like one whom the satans have enticed into blundering after earthly lusts, the while his companions, trying to guide him, call out unto him [from afar], ‘Come thou to us!’" Say: "Verily, God’s guidance is the only guidance: and so we have been bidden to surrender ourselves unto the Sustainer of all the worlds,
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:111: and to be constant in prayer and conscious of Him: for it is He unto whom you all shall be gathered.
Muhammad Asad.verse 6:112: And He it is who has created the heavens and the earth in accordance with [an inner] truth – and whenever He says, "Be," His word comes true; and His will be the dominion on the Day when the trumpet [of resurrection] is blown.

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:1: All praise belongs to Allah who created the heavens and the earth, and made darkness and light; yet those who disbelieve equate (others) with their Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:2: He is the One who created you from clay, then destined a term.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:3: He is the true God in the heavens and the earth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:4: Yet whenever a sign from the signs of their Lord comes to them, they do nothing but turn away from it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:5: So they rejected the truth when it came to them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:6: Have they not seen how many generations We have destroyed prior to them-those whom We had given such a strong position in the land as We did not give to you, and We poured on them abundant rains from the sky, and made rivers flow beneath them? Then We destroyed them because of their sins, and raised up another generation after them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:7: If We had sent down to you something written on paper, and they had even touched it with their hands, still the disbelievers would have said, “This is nothing but obvious magic.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:8: They say, “Why is it that an angel has not been sent down to him?” Had We sent down an angel, the whole matter would have been closed, and thereafter no further time would have been allowed to them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:9: If We had made him an angel, We would have obviously made him a man, and would have caused them the same confusion they are causing now.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:10: Even before you (O Prophet,) many messengers were ridiculed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:11: Say, “Go about the earth, and see what was the fate of those who rejected (the prophets).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:12: Say, “To whom belongs all that is in the heavens and on the earth?” Say, “To Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:13: To Him belongs all that dwells in the night and the day.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:14: Say, “Would I take as guardian someone other than Allah Who is the Creator of the heavens and the earth, and Who feeds others, and is not fed by anyone?” Say, “I have been asked to be the first to submit (to Him) and never to be one of those who ascribe partners to Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:15: Say, “If I disobey my Lord, I fear the punishment of a momentous day.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:16: Whoever is spared from it (the punishment of that day) is, indeed, blessed with His mercy.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:17: If Allah causes you harm, there is no one to remove it except He Himself; and if He causes you good, then He is powerful over everything.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:18: He is Dominant over His servants, and He is the All-Wise, the All-Aware.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:19: Say, “Whose testimony is the greatest?” Say, “Allah is the witness between me and you, and this Qur’ān has been revealed to me so that I should thereby warn you, and whomsoever it may reach.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:20: Those to whom We have given the Book recognize him (the Messenger) as (certainly as) they would recognize their sons.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:21: Who is more unjust than one who invents a lie against Allah or rejects His signs? Beware, the unjust shall not prosper.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:22: (Be mindful of) the Day We shall gather them together, then We will say to those who associated partners with Allah, “Where are those you claimed to be partners of Allah?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:23: Then, they will have no other mischievous move but that they will say, “By Allah, our Lord, we ascribed no partners to Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:24: See how they will lie about themselves, and all that they used to forge will vanish from them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:25: There are those among them who (apparently) listen to you, but We have put coverings on their hearts, so that they do not understand, and heaviness in their ears.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:26: From it (the Qur’ān) they prevent others, and from it they keep themselves away.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:27: If only you could (be there to) see when they will be made to stand by the Fire, and they will say, “Would that we were sent back, then we would not reject the signs of our Lord, and would join the believers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:28: In fact, what they were concealing earlier will become clear to them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:29: They say, “There is nothing but this worldly life of ours, and we are not going to be raised again.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:30: If only you could see when they will be made to stand before their Lord! He will say, “Is this not true?” They will say, “Of course, by our Lord, it is.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:31: Losers indeed are those who deny that they will ever face Allah, until when the Hour will come upon them suddenly, they will say, “Alas! We have been negligent about it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:32: The worldly life is nothing but a game and fun, and the last abode is surely much better for those who fear Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:33: Indeed We know that what they say makes you sad, because it is not you whom they reject, but the transgressors actually deny the signs of Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:34: Indeed, many messengers have been rejected before you, but they stood patient against their rejection, and they were persecuted until Our help came to them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:35: If their aversion is too hard on you, then seek, if you can, a tunnel into the earth or a ladder unto the sky in order to bring them a sign.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:36: Only those respond who listen (to seek the truth).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:37: They say, “Why is it that no sign (of our choice) has been sent down to him from his Lord?” Say, “Allah is surely powerful enough to send down a sign.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:38: There is no creature moving on the earth, nor a bird flying on its two wings, but they are all communities like you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:39: Those who gave the lie to Our signs are deaf and dumb, in layers of darkness.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:40: Say, “Tell me if the punishment of Allah comes to you or the Hour befalls you, would you call someone other than Allah, if you are truthful?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:41: Rather, Him alone you will call and He, if He wills, shall remove what you call Him for, and you will forget those you associate with Him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:42: We did send messengers to communities before you and put them to hardships and sufferings, so that they may supplicate in humility.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:43: Why then, did they not supplicate in humility when a calamity from Us came upon them? Instead, their hearts were hardened and Satan adorned for them what they were doing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:44: Thereafter, when they forgot the advice they were given, We opened for them doors of everything, so that when they became proud of what they were given, We seized them suddenly and they were left in despair.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:45: Thus, the people who did wrong were uprooted to the last man; Praise be to Allah, the Lord of the worlds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:46: Say, “Tell me, if Allah takes away your hearing and your sights and sets a seal on your hearts, which god other than Allah can bring these back to you?” See how We put forth Our verses in various forms? Yet, still they turn away.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:47: Say, “Tell me if the punishment of Allah comes upon you whether suddenly or openly, shall any people be destroyed except the unjust?’
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:48: We do not send the messengers but as bearers of good tidings and as warners.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:49: whereas those who have rejected Our signs, torment shall afflict them, because they used to commit sins.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:50: Say, “I do not say to you that I have the treasures of Allah, nor do I have the knowledge of the Unseen, nor do I say to you that I am an angel.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:51: Warn, with it, those who have the fear of being gathered before their Lord, with no one other than Him to support or to intercede.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:52: Do not expel those who call out to their Lord morning and evening seeking His pleasure.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:53: Thus We have tested some of them through others, so that they should say, “Are these the ones among all of us whom Allah has chosen for His favour?” Yes, does Allah not know well who are the grateful?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:54: When those who believe in Our verses come to you, say to them, “Peace on you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:55: This is how We explain the verses in detail, so that the way of the guilty may become exposed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:56: Say, “I have been forbidden from worshiping those whom you invoke beside Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:57: Say, “I am on clear guidance from my Lord, and you have cried lies to it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:58: Say, “If what you demand to be hastened were up to me, the matter between me and you would have been over.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:59: With Him are the keys of the Unseen.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:60: He is the One who recalls your souls by night, and knows what you do by day; then He makes you rise up therein, so that a fixed term may be fulfilled.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:61: He is Dominant over His slaves, and He sends guardians over you until when death comes upon one of you, Our deputies take his soul in full, and they neglect nothing (from their duties).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:62: Then all of them will be returned to Allah, their real Master.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:63: Say, “Who is the One who delivers you from the darkness of the land and the sea when you supplicate Him in humility and in low tones (promising): ‘If He delivers us from this, We shall truly become grateful?’”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:64: Say, “Allah delivers you from it and from every pain; Yet still, you associate partners with Him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:65: Say, “He is fully capable that He should send a punishment from above you or from beneath your feet, or to put you in confusion through divisions, and make some of you taste troubles through some others.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:66: Your people have rejected it (the Qur’ān) while it is the whole truth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:67: For every event there is a point (of time and place) to occur, and you will soon know (it).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:68: When you see those who indulge in (blaspheming) Our verses, turn away from them until they become occupied with some other discourse.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:69: Those who fear Allah are not responsible for any (evil) act in the account of these (infidels), except for advising them, so that they may be careful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:70: Avoid those who have taken their faith as fun and games.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:71: Say, “Should we invoke, besides Allah, something that can neither benefit us nor harm us? Should we turn back on our heels after Allah has guided us? (If we do so, we will be) like the one whom the devils have abducted to a far off land, leaving him bewildered, even though he has friends who call him to the right path (saying), “Come to us.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:72: and establish Salāh, and heed Him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:73: He is the One who created the heavens and the earth with purpose.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:74: (Remember) when Ibrāhīm said to his father, ’Āzar: “Do you take idols for gods? I see you and your people in manifest error.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:75: Thus We showed Ibrāhīm the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, so that he might be firm in belief.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:76: So, when the night enveloped him, he saw a star.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:77: Later, when he saw the moon rising, he said, “This is my Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:78: Thereafter, when he saw the sun rising, he said, “This is my Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:79: I have, indeed, turned my face straight towards the One who created the heavens and the earth, and I am not one of those who associate partners with Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:81: How can I fear that which you associate with Him, while you do not fear (the evil fate of) your having associated with Allah something for which He did not send down to you any authority? Now, which of the two parties has more right to be in peace? (Tell me) if you know.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:82: Those who have believed and have not mixed their faith with injustice are the ones who deserve peace, and it is they who are on the right path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:83: That is the decisive argument from Us that We gave to Ibrāhīm against his people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:84: We bestowed upon him IsHāq and Ya‘qūb .
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:85: and (We guided) Zakariyyā and YaHyā and ‘Īsā and Ilyās -each one of them was of the righteous-
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:86: -and Ismā‘īl and Yasa‘ and Yūnus and LūT, and all of them We made to excel over all the people of the world (in their respective times).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:87: We guided many among their fathers and their children and their brothers, and We chose them and led them on to the straight path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:89: They are those whom We have given the Book and wisdom and prophethood.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:90: Those are the people whom Allah has guided.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:91: They did not hold Allah in due esteem when they said, “Allah has not sent down anything to a human being.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:92: This is indeed a Blessed Book We have sent down, confirming what was (revealed) before it, so that you may warn the town which is the Mother of All Towns, (i.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:93: Who is more unjust than the one who fabricates a lie against Allah or says, “Revelation has been sent to me”, whereas no revelation has been sent to him, and the one who says, “I would produce the like of what Allah has revealed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:94: You have come to Us all alone, just as We had first created you, and you have left behind you what We had bestowed on you, and We do not see your intercessors with you - those whom you claimed to be (Our) partners in (managing) your matters.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:95: Surely, Allah is the one who splits the grain and the date-stone (for sprouting).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:96: (He is) the One who causes the dawn to break.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:97: He is the One who made for you the stars, so that you may be guided by them in darkness of the land and the sea.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:98: He is the One who created you from one person, then, you have a place to dwell and a place to sojourn.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:99: He is the One who sent down water from the heavens.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:100: They have invented the Jinns as partners with Allah, while He has created them; and they have fabricated for Him sons and daughters without any knowledge.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:101: (He is) the Originator of the heavens and the earth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:102: This is Allah: your Lord, there is no God but He, the Creator of everything; so, worship Him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:103: No vision can comprehend Him, and He comprehends all visions, and He is Absolutely Subtle, All-Aware.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:104: (Say, O Prophet :) There have come to you insights from your Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:105: This is how We bring the verses in diverse ways, so that they say, “you have been tutored”, and so that We may explain it to people who have knowledge.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:106: Follow what has been revealed to you from your Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:107: If Allah willed, they would not have associated.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:108: Do not revile those whom they invoke other than Allah, lest they should revile Allah in transgression without having knowledge.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:109: They have sworn forceful oaths by Allah that if a sign comes to them, they will surely believe in it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:110: We will upset their hearts and sights, as they did not believe in them at the first instance, and We will leave them wandering blindly in their rebellion.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:111: If We had sent down to them the angels, and the dead had spoken to them, and (even if) We had gathered everything before them face to face, still, they were not to believe, unless Allah would have so willed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:112: So it is that, for every prophet, We have set up enemies,-the devils of mankind and jinn-who seduce one another with alluring rhetoric in order to deceive-Had Allah willed, they would have not done it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:113: -and (they seduce one another) in order that the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter may incline to it, and that they may be well pleased with it, and so that they commit what those (seducers) are used to commit.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:114: So, should I seek someone other than Allah as judge, while it is He who has sent down to you the Book in details? Those We have given the Book know that it is revealed from your Lord with the truth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:115: The Word of your Lord is perfect in truth and justice.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:116: If you obey the majority of those on earth, they will make you lose the way of Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:117: Surely, your Lord is best aware of those who go astray from His way, and He is best aware of those who are on the right path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:118: So, eat (the flesh) of that (animal) upon which the name of Allah has been invoked (when slaughtering), if you do believe in His verses.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:119: What should cause you to avoid eating of that upon which the name of Allah has been invoked, while He has spelled out to you all that He has made unlawful for you, except that to which you are compelled by extreme necessity? Surely, there are many who misguide people on the basis of their desires without having knowledge.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:120: Leave outward sin and inward sin.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:121: Do not eat that (meat) over which the name of Allah has not been pronounced.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:122: Is it (conceivable) that the one who was dead and to whom We gave life, and set for him a light with which he walks among men, (is held to) be like the one whose condition is such that he is in total darkness, never coming out of it? This is how their deeds appear beautified to the disbelievers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:123: In a similar way, in every town We caused its chief sinners to commit mischief in it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:124: When a sign comes to them, they say, “We shall never come to believe unless we are given the like of what was given to the messengers of Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:125: So, whomsoever Allah wills to guide, He makes his heart wide open for Islam, and whomsoever He wills to let go astray, He makes his heart strait and constricted, (and he feels embracing Islam as difficult) as if he were climbing to the sky.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:126: This is the path of your Lord, a straight path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:127: For them there is the Abode of Peace with their Lord, and He is their Guardian by virtue of what they used to do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:128: The day He will assemble all of them together, (Allah will say to Jinn) “O species of Jinns, you have done too much against mankind.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:129: Thus We will make some wrongdoers companions of others (in the Hereafter) because of what they used to commit.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:130: “O species of Jinn and mankind, had the messengers not come to you, from among yourselves, who used to relate My verses to you, and used to warn you of the encounter of this your day?” They will say, “We testify against ourselves.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:131: That (Allah sends messengers) is because your Lord is not to destroy any towns on account of any wrongdoing, while their people are unaware.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:132: For all people, there are ranks according to what they did, and your Lord is not unaware of what they do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:133: Your Lord is the All-Independent, the Lord of Mercy.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:134: Surely what you are promised is bound to come, and you cannot frustrate (it).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:135: Say, “O my people, do at your place (whatever you do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:136: They have assigned a portion for Allah from the tillage and the cattle created by Him, and then said, “This is for Allah”, so they claim, “And this is for our associate-gods.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:137: Similarly, their associate-gods have made the killing of their children seem fair to many mushriks (idolators), so that they may ruin them and may confuse their faith for them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:138: They say, “These are prohibited cattle and produce; none can eat them except those whom we wish” - so they claimed - “and there are cattle whose backs are prohibited (for riding or loading)”, and there are cattle over which they do not pronounce the name of Allah,-all being fabrications against Him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:139: They say, “Whatever is in the wombs of these cattle is purely for our males, and forbidden to our wives.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:140: Losers are those who kill their children foolishly, without knowledge, and hold as prohibited what Allah has provided them, falsely ascribing it to Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:141: He is the One who has created gardens, trellised and untrellised, and date-palms and crops with a variety of edibles, and the olive and the pomegranate, (some) similar to one another, and (some) dissimilar.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:142: Among cattle (He has created) those fit for loading and those fit for laying on the floor.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:143: (Allah has created) eight pairs: two of sheep and two of goats.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:144: And (He has created) two of camels and two of oxen.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:145: Say, “I do not find, in what has been revealed to me, anything (out of the cattle under discussion) prohibited for anyone who eats it, unless it be carrion or blood that pours forth, or flesh of swine - because it is impure - or there be an animal slaughtered sinfully by invoking on it the name of someone other than Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:146: For those who are Jews We prohibited all that has claws.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:147: Then, if they give the lie to you, say, “Your Lord is the Lord of all-embracing mercy, and His punishment cannot be averted from the sinning people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:148: Those who associate partners with Allah will say, “Had Allah willed, we would have not associated (partners with Him), nor our fathers, nor would we have made anything prohibited.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:149: Say, “Then, Allah’s is the conclusive proof.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:150: Say, “Bring your witnesses who testify that Allah has prohibited this.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:151: Say (O Prophet to the infidels), “Come, and I shall recite what your Lord has prohibited for you: Do not associate anything with Him (as His partner); and be good to parents, and do not kill your children because of poverty - We will give provision to you, and to them as well - and do not go near shameful acts, whether they are open or secret; and do not kill a person whom Allah has given sanctity, except rightfully.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:152: Do not approach the property of the orphan, except with the best possible conduct, until he reaches maturity.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:153: And: This is My path that is straightforward.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:154: Then We gave Mūsā the Book, perfect for the one who does good, and explaining everything in detail, and a guidance and mercy, so that they may believe in meeting their Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:155: And this (Qur’ān) is a blessed Book We have sent down.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:156: (Had We not sent this book,) you would (have an excuse to) say, “The Book was sent down only upon two groups before us, (i.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:157: Or you would say, “If the Book had been sent down to us, we would have been more adhering to the right path than they are.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:158: They are waiting for nothing less than that the angels should come to them, or your Lord or some signs of your Lord should come.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:159: Surely, those who have made divisions in their religion and turned into factions, you have nothing to do with them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:160: Whoever comes with a good deed will receive ten times as much, and whoever comes with an evil deed will be requited with no more than the like of it, and they shall not be wronged.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:161: Say, “As for me, my Lord has guided me to a straight path, the straight religion, the faith of Ibrāhīm who was upright and was not of those who associate partners with Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:162: Say, “My prayer, my offering, my life and my death are for Allah, the Lord of all the worlds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:163: For Him there is no partner.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:164: Say, “Should I seek a lord other than Allah while He is the Lord of everything? And nobody does anything but to his own account, and no bearer of burden shall bear the burden of another.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 6:165: It is He who made you the vicegerents of the earth and raised some of you in ranks over others, so that He may test you in what He has given you.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:1: Praise be to God Who created the heavens and the earth - and He appointed darknesses and light; then those who disbelieve ascribe equals to their Lord.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:2: It is He Who created you from clay; then He decreed a term.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:3: He is God in the heavens and in the earth.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:4: Not a verse of the verses of their Lord comes to them, but they turn away from it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:5: They denied the truth when it came to them, but there shall come to them the news of what they were mocking.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:6: Have they not seen how many a generation We destroyed before them; We established them as We have not established you; and how We unleashed the heaven upon them in torrents and made the rivers to flow beneath them? Then We destroyed them because of their sins; and We raised up after them another generation.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:7: And had We revealed to you a Scripture on parchment and had they then touched it with their hands, the disbelievers would have said: 'This is nothing but manifest sorcery'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:8: And they say, 'Why has an angel not been sent down to him?'; yet had We sent down an angel, the matter would have been decreed, and then they would not be given any respite.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:9: And had We appointed him an angel, We would assuredly have made him a man; and We would have assuredly confused for them what they are confusing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:10: And messengers were indeed mocked before you, but those who scoffed at them were encompassed by that which they mocked.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:11: Say: 'Travel in the land, and see the nature of the consequence for the deniers'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:12: Say: 'To whom belongs what is in the heavens and in the earth?' Say: 'To God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:13: And to Him belongs all that inhabits the night and the day; and He is the Hearer, the Knower'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:14: Say: 'Shall I take as a protector other than God, the Originator of the heavens and the earth, He Who feeds and is not fed?' Say: 'I have been commanded to be the first to submit, and: "Do not be among those who associate others" '.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:15: Say: 'Indeed I fear, if I should rebel against my Lord, the chastisement of a dreadful day'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:16: He from whom it is averted on that day, He will have had mercy on him; that is the manifest triumph.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:17: And if God touches you with an affliction, then none can remove it, except Him; and if He touches you with good, then He has power over all things.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:18: He is the Vanquisher over His servants, and He is the Wise, the Aware.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:19: Say: ‘What thing is greatest in testimony?’ Say: ‘God is Witness between me and you, and this Qur’ān has been revealed to me that I may warn you, [thereby, and whomever it may reach.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:20: Those to whom We have given the Scripture recognise him as they recognise their sons; those who have forfeited their own souls do not believe.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:21: And who does greater evil than he who invents a lie against God, or denies His signs? They the evildoers shall not prosper.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:22: And on the day We shall gather them all together, then We shall say to those who associated other gods with God, 'Where are those associates of yours whom you were claiming?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:23: Then their dissension was only to say, 'By God, our Lord we were never idolaters'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:24: See how they lie against themselves and how that which they were forging has failed them!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:25: And there are some of them who listen to you, and We have placed veils upon their hearts so that they do not understand it; and in their ears a heaviness.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:26: And they forbid it and keep away from it; and it is only themselves they destroy, but they do not perceive.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:27: If you could see when they are made to stand before the Fire, and they say, 'Oh would that we might be returned; then we would not deny the signs of our Lord, but we would be among the believers!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:28: Nay that which they used to conceal before has now become evident to them; and even if they were returned, they would return to that which they are forbidden; they are truly liars.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:29: And they say, 'There is no other than our present life; we shall not be resurrected'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:30: If you could see when they are made to stand before their Lord.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:31: They indeed are losers who deny the encounter with God, until when the Hour comes upon them suddenly, they shall say, 'Alas for us that we neglected it!' On their backs they shall be bearing their burdens.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:32: The life of this world is nothing but a game and a diversion; surely the abode of the Hereafter is better for those who fear.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:33: We know indeed that it grieves you that which they say; yet it is not that they deny you, but evildoers knowingly reject the signs of God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:34: Messengers indeed have been denied before you; yet they endured patiently the denial and the persecution until Our victorious help came to them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:35: And if their aversion is grievous for you, then, if you can, seek out a hole in the earth, or a ladder to heaven, that you may bring them a sign, but had God willed, He would have gathered them together in guidance; so do not be among the ignorant.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:36: Only those who hear will answer; as for the dead, God will resurrect them, and then to Him they will be returned.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:37: And they say, 'Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?' Say, 'Surely God has the power to send down a sign, but most of them do not know'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:38: There is no animal on the earth and no bird that flies with its wings, but they are communities like to you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:39: And those who deny Our signs are deaf, and dumb, in darkness.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:40: Say, 'Do you see yourselves if God's chastisement comes upon you, or the Hour comes upon you, will ye call upon any other than God? If you speak truly!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:41: Nay; upon Him you will call, and He will remove that which you call upon Him, if He wills, and you will forget what you associate with Him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:42: Indeed We sent to communities before you, and We seized them with misery and hardship so that they might be humble.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:43: If only, when Our might came upon them, they had been humble.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:44: So, when they forgot that whereof they were reminded, We opened to them the gates of all things until, when they rejoiced in what they were given, We seized them suddenly and lo! they were confounded.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:45: So the last remnant of the people who did evil was cut off.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:46: Say, 'Have you considered if God were to seize your hearing and your sight, and set a seal upon your hearts, who is the god other than God to give it back to you?' See how We dispense the signs! Yet thereafter they are turning away.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:47: Say, 'Have you considered for yourselves, if God's chastisement were to come upon you, suddenly or openly?; Would any be destroyed, except the evildoing folk?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:48: We do not send messengers, except as bearers of good tidings and as warners.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:49: But those who deny Our signs, the chastisement shall afflict them because they were wicked.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:50: Say: 'I do not say to you, "I possess the treasure houses of God"; and I do not have knowledge of the Unseen.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:51: And warn therewith those who fear they shall be gathered to their Lord: apart from Him they have no protector and no intercessor so that they might be wary.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:52: And do not drive away those who call upon their Lord at morning and evening desiring His countenance.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:53: And even so We have tried some of them by others so that they may say, 'Are these the ones whom God has favoured from among us?' Is God not best aware of those who are thankful?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:54: And when those who believe in Our signs come to you, say, 'Peace be upon you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:55: And thus We distinguish the signs, and that the way of the sinners may be become clear.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:56: Say: 'Truly I have been forbidden to worship those whom you call upon, besides God'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:57: Say: 'I am upon a clear proof from my Lord, and you have denied Him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:58: Say, 'If I did have what you seek to hasten, the matter between you and me would have been decided; and God knows best the evildoers'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:59: And with Him are the keys of the Unseen; none but He knows them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:60: It is He Who takes you at night, and He knows what you commit by day.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:61: He is the Vanquisher over His servants.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:62: Then they are restored to God their Protector, the True.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:63: Say: 'Who delivers you from the darkness of the land and the sea; you call upon Him openly and secretly: "Verily, if You deliver us from this, we shall truly be among the thankful" '.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:64: Say: ‘God delivers you from that and from every distress.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:65: Say: 'He has the power to send forth upon you a chastisement from above you, or from beneath your feet, or to confound you in parties, and to make you taste the violence of one another'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:68: When you see those who engage in discourse about Our signs, turn away from them until they discourse on some other topic.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:69: Those who fear are not accountable for them in anything; but it is the reminder so that perhaps they will be wary.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:70: And forsake those who take their religion as a game and a diversion, and whom the life of this world has deluded.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:71: Say: 'Shall we call upon, instead of God, that which neither profits us, nor hurts us; and so be turned back after God has guided us? - Like one whom the devils have lured in the earth, bewildered; he has companions, who call him to guidance: “Come to us!” Say: 'Truly, God's guidance is [the true] guidance and we have been commanded to submit to the Lord of the Worlds,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:72: and to establishing prayer and fearing Him; He it is to Whom you shall be gathered'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:73: He it is Who created the heavens and the earth in truth.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:74: And when Abraham said to his father āzar, ‘Do you take idols as gods? I see you and your people in manifest error’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:75: And so We show Abraham the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and that he might be of those knowing with certainty.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:76: When night descended upon him he saw a star and said, 'This is my Lord'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:77: And when he saw the moon rising, he said, 'This is my Lord'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:78: And when he saw the sun rising, he said, 'This is my Lord; this is greater!' But when it set, he said, 'O my people, surely I am innocent of what you associate.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:79: Verily I have turned my face to Him Who originated the heavens and the earth; a hanīf, and I am not of those that associate others’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:80: But his people disputed with him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:81: How should I fear what you have associated, and you fear not, that you have associated with God that for which He has not revealed to you any warrant?' Which of the two parties has more right to security if you have any knowledge?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:82: Those who believe and have not confounded their belief with evildoing, theirs is security; and they are rightly guided.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:83: That argument of Ours We bestowed upon Abraham against his people.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:84: And We bestowed upon him Isaac and Jacob; each one We guided.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:85: And Zachariah and John, and Jesus, and Elias; all were of the righteous.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:86: And Ishmael and Elisha, and Jonah and Lot, all We preferred above all the worlds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:87: And of their fathers, and of their seed, and of their brethren; and We chose them and We guided them to a straight path.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:88: That is God's guidance wherewith He guides whom He will of His servants; had they been idolaters, all that they did would have been in vain.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:89: They are the ones to whom We gave the Scripture, judgement, and prophethood; so if these disbelieve therein, then indeed We have entrusted it to a people who do not disbelieve in it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:90: They are the ones whom God has guided; so follow their guidance.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:91: They measured not God with His true measure when they said, 'God has not revealed anything to any mortal'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:92: And this is a blessed Book We have revealed, confirming that which was before it, and that you may warn the Mother of Towns and those around it; and those who believe in the Hereafter believe in it, and they observe their prayers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:93: And who does greater evil than he who invents lies against God, or who says, 'It is revealed to me', when nothing has been revealed to him or he who says, 'I will reveal the like of what God has revealed'?; If you could only see when the evildoers are in the agonies of death and the angels extend their hands, 'Give up your souls! Today you shall be requited with the chastisement of humiliation because you used to say about God other than the truth, and that you used to scorn His signs'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:94: And now you have come to Us singly, as We created you the first time, and you have left what We conferred on you behind your backs; and We do not see with you your intercessors whom you claimed to be associates amongst you; it has been severed between you, and that which you claimed has failed you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:95: God it is Who splits the grain and the date-stone.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:96: He is the Cleaver of the daybreak and He has appointed the night for stillness and the sun and the moon for reckoning.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:97: And He it is Who appointed for you the stars that you may guide your course by them amid the darkness of land and sea.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:98: And He it is Who produced you from a single soul, such that some are established and some are deposited.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:99: And He it is Who sent down water from the heaven and therewith We bring forth plants of every kind, and therefrom We bring forth verdure, bringing forth from it thick-clustered grain, and from the palm-tree from its pollen spring bunches of dates, bunched up, and gardens of grapes, and olives, and pomegranates, similar, but not alike.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:100: Yet they ascribe to God as associates the jinn, even though He created them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:101: The Originator of the heavens and the earth; how should He have a son, when He has no consort, and He created everything, and He has knowledge of all things?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:102: That then is God, your Lord.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:103: Vision cannot attain Him, but He attains
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:105: Clear proofs have come to you from your Lord; whoever perceives, then it is for his own good; and whoever is blind, then it will be to his own hurt.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:106: And so, We dispense the signs, and that they may say, 'You have studied with someone', and that We may make it clear for a people who have knowledge.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:107: Follow what has been revealed to you from your Lord.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:108: Had God willed, they would not have been idolaters; and We have not set you as a keeper over them; nor are you a guardian over them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:109: Do not revile those whom they call upon, besides God, lest they then revile God out of spite, through ignorance.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:110: They have sworn by God the most earnest oaths that if there came to them a sign, they will believe in it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:111: And We shall confound their hearts and their eyes; just as they did not believe in it the first time; and We shall leave them in their insolence, wandering blindly.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:112: And if We had sent down the angels to them, and the dead had spoken with them, and We had gathered against them all things in droves, yet they would not have believed, unless God willed; but most of them are ignorant.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:113: And so We have appointed to every Prophet an enemy, devils of mankind and jinn who inspire fine speech to each other in delusion; yet, had your Lord willed, they would never have done it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:114: And that the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter may incline to it, and that they may be pleased with it, and that they may acquire what they are acquiring.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:115: Shall I seek other than God as a judge, when it is He Who revealed to you the Book, clearly explained? Those to whom We have given the Scripture know that it is revealed from your Lord in truth; so do not be of the waverers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:116: Perfected is the word of your Lord in truthfulness and justice; none can change His words.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:117: If you obey most of those on earth, they will lead you astray from the way of God; they follow only supposition; they are merely guessing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:118: Your Lord knows best those who stray from His way and He knows well the rightly guided.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:119: So eat from that over which God's Name has been invoked, if you believe in His signs.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:120: What is wrong with you, that you do not eat from that over which God's Name has been invoked when He has detailed for you what He has forbidden, except that to which you are compelled? But truly many are led astray by their whims without any knowledge.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:121: And forsake outward aspect of sin and its inward aspect; surely those who earn sin shall be requited for what they used to perpetrate.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:122: And do not eat from that over which God's Name has not been invoked, verily it is wickedness.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:123: Why, is he who was dead, and We gave him life, and appointed for him a light by which to walk among people, as him whose likeness is in darkness whence he cannot emerge? So, what the disbelievers have been doing has been adorned for them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:124: And thus, We have made in every city its sinners great ones, that they may plot therein; but they plot only against themselves, though they do not perceive.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:125: And when a sign comes to them, they say, 'We will not believe, until we are given the like of what God's messengers were given'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:126: Whomever God desires to guide, He expands his breast to Islam; and whomever He desires to send astray, He makes his breast narrow and constricted, as if he were engaged in ascent to the heaven.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:127: And this is the path of your Lord, a straight one.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:128: Theirs will be the abode of peace with their Lord, and He will be their Friend because of what they used to do.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:129: And, the day when He shall gather them all together, 'O assembly of jinn, you have garnered much of mankind'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:130: So, We let some of the evildoers have power over others because of what they are wont to earn.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:131: 'O assembly of jinn and mankind, did not messengers come to you from among you to recount to you My signs and to warn you of the encounter of this Day of yours?' They shall say, 'We bear witness against ourselves'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:132: That is because your Lord would never destroy the towns through injustice, while their inhabitants were heedless.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:133: All shall have degrees according to what they have done.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:134: Your Lord is Independent, the Lord of Mercy.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:135: Truly, that which you are promised will surely come to pass, and you cannot escape.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:136: Say, 'O my people, act according to your state; truly I am acting.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:137: They assign to God, of the tillage and the cattle which He multiplied, a portion, saying, 'This is for God' - so they assert - 'and this is for our associates'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:138: And thus, those associates of theirs have adorned for many of the idolaters the slaying of their children that they may destroy them and to confuse their religion for them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:139: They say, 'These cattle and tillage are sacrosanct.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:140: And they say, 'That which is within the bellies of these cattle is reserved for our males and forbidden to our spouses; but if it be dead then they
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:142: They are losers who slay their children in folly without knowledge, and have forbidden what God has provided them in calumny against God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:143: And He it is Who produces gardens, trellised and untrellised, and palm-trees, and crops diverse in flavour, and olives, and pomegranates, alike and unlike.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:144: And, of the cattle some for burden, and some for light support; eat of that which God has provided you and do not follow the steps of Satan.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:145: Eight pairs: two of sheep; and of goats two.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:146: And of the camels two and of the oxen two.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:147: Say: 'I do not find, in what is revealed to me, anything forbidden to him who eats thereof except it be carrion or blood poured forth, or the flesh of swine - that indeed is an abomination, or a wicked thing that has been hallowed to other than God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:148: And to those of Jewry, We forbade every beast with hoof; and of oxen and sheep We forbade them the fat of them, save what their backs carry, or their entrails, or what is mingled with bone; that, We requited them for their insolence; verily We are truthful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:149: So, if they deny you, then say: 'Your Lord is of the Lord of all-embracing mercy, and His might will never be driven back from the sinning folk'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:150: The idolaters will say, 'Had God willed, we would not have been idolaters, neither our fathers, nor would we have forbidden anything'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:151: Say: 'To God belongs the conclusive argument, for had He willed, He could have guided all of you'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:152: Say: 'Come, your witnesses, those who can testify that God has forbidden this'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:153: Say: 'Come, I will recite that which your Lord has made a sacred duty for you: that you associate nothing with Him, that you be dutiful to parents, and that you do not slay your children, because of poverty - We will provide for you and them - and that you do not draw near any acts of lewdness, whether it be manifest or concealed, and that you do not slay the life which God has made sacred, except rightfully.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:154: And that you do not approach the property of the orphan save with that, which is fairer, until he is of age.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:155: And that this is My straight path, so follow it; and do not follow other ways, lest it separate you away from His way.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:156: Then We gave Moses the Scripture, complete for him who does good, and a detailing of all things, and as a guidance and a mercy, that perhaps they might believe in the encounter with their Lord.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:157: And this is a blessed Book which We have revealed; so follow it, and be wary, that perhaps you might find mercy.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:158: Lest you should say, 'The Scripture was revealed only upon two parties before us and we indeed have been unacquainted with their study'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:159: Or lest you should say, 'If the Scripture had been revealed to us, we would have surely been more rightly guided than they are'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:160: Are they waiting for nothing less than that the angels should come to them, or that your Lord should come, or that one of your Lord's signs should come? On the day that one of your Lord's signs comes it shall not benefit a soul to believe if it had not believed theretofore or earned in its belief some good.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:161: Those who have sundered their religion, and have become differing parties, you have no concern with them at all.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:162: Whoever brings a good deed, shall receive tenfold the like of it, and whoever brings an evil deed shall only be requited the like of it; and they shall not be wronged.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:163: Say: ‘As for me, my Lord has guided me to a straight path, a right religion, the creed of Abraham, a hanīf; and he was not of the idolaters’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:164: Say: 'My prayer and my rituals, and my living, and my dying, are all for God, the Lord of the Worlds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:166: Say: 'Shall I seek any other than God for a lord, when He is the Lord of all things?' Every soul earns only against itself; and no burdened soul shall bear the burden of another.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 6:167: And He it is Who has made you successors in the earth and has raised some of you above others in degrees, so that He may try you in what He has given you.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 6:1: All praise belongs to Allah alone, Who created the heavens and the earth and produced darkness and light; yet the disbelievers set up (false gods as) equals to their Lord.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 6:2: (Allah) is He Who created you from mud (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 6:3: And He alone is Allah (the True God to be worshipped) in the heavens and the earth Who knows (all) your hidden and your open (things).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 6:4: And there comes to them no sign of the signs of their Lord but (that) they turn away from it.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 6:5: Then indeed (the same way) they belied the truth (the Qur’an as well) when it came to them (as a sign of Allah).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 6:6: Have they not seen how many a generation We eliminated before them whom We had given (such an indomitable) dominion (and stronghold) in the land as We have not given even to you? And We sent upon them persistently falling rain, and caused streams to flow beneath (their dwellings and castles).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 6:7: And had We revealed to you a book written on paper which these people could also have touched with their own hands, (even) then the disbelievers would have said: ‘This is (nothing) but sheer magic.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 6:9: And if We had made the Messenger an angel, even then We would have made him (the form of) a man, and (even in that case) We would have put them in the same doubt which they are (already) in (i.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 6:15: Say: ‘Surely, I fear the Day of a mighty torment if I disobey my Lord.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 6:33: (O Beloved!) We assuredly know that (what) they say grieves you.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 6:36: The truth is that they alone who listen to it (with truthful hearts) accept (the invitation of truth).

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 6:38: And, (O mankind,) there is no moving (animal) on the earth nor a bird that flies on its two wings but (such) that they are species like you (umamun amthalu-kum—in several traits).

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 6:152: Say: ‘Come, I will recite to you those things which your Lord has forbidden to you: Do not set up anything as a partner with Him; be morally excellent with parents; and do not kill your children owing to poverty.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 6:153: And do not go near the property of the orphan but in the most likable manner until he reaches the age of maturity.
